translation.en: You know, we're told to eat healthy,
to sort of shop the perimeters of the grocery stores,
translation.ko: 식품점에 가면 농축산물 코너에서 사라고 하죠

translation.en: but I think what a lot of people don't realize
translation.ko: 많은 분이 잘 모르시는 것 같은데

translation.en: is… this also may be the riskiest areas.
translation.ko: 많은 분이 잘 모르시는 것 같은데 농축산물 코너도 가장 위험한 곳일 수 있어요

translation.en: You know, when I look around,
I probably see 10, 15 different items.
The product's been contaminated, or I sued companies on behalf of victims.
translation.ko: 오염됐었거나, 제가 피해자 대신 회사에 소송을 걸었던 제품이네요

translation.en: [chuckles] I've litigated plenty of cases of romaine lettuce.
Cut fruit, you know, countless outbreaks.
Cut cantaloupe.
Strawberries.
Caramel apples.
Tomatoes. Onions. Cookie dough.
The Similac infant formula.
Lucky Charms.
Chicken, you know, all these products are likely contaminated.
translation.ko: 닭고기는 모든 제품이 오염됐을 수 있어요

translation.en: It starts to feel, though, like nothing is safe, and you can't eat. Right?
translation.ko: 말씀을 들으니까 안전한 게 없고 먹을 수가 없겠는데요?

translation.en: Yeah, I mean, you know, the industry, they send us these mixed messages.
translation.ko: 네, 그러니까 업계가 모순적인 태도를 보인다는 거예요

translation.en: They want us to buy their product,
but they ultimately don't want to be responsible… for what they produce.
translation.ko: 자기들이 생산한 제품에 대해 책임지고 싶어 하진 않아요

translation.en: Until I show up.
We have by far the safest food supply in the entire world.
translation.ko: 우리는 전 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 공급망을 갖추고 있습니다

translation.en: [woman 1] The safest food supply in the world.
Let's remember one thing, we have the safest food supply
translation.ko: 이걸 잊지 맙시다 전 세계에서 가장 안전한

translation.en: in the world right here in the US.
[reporter 1] The FDA is investigating a hepatitis A outbreak,
possibly linked to organic fresh strawberries.
A multistate salmonella outbreak.
Health experts believe it is linked to some Jif peanut butter products.
translation.ko: 보건 전문가들은 지프 땅콩버터와 연관성이 있다고 생각합니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] The recalls come after at least two infant deaths
and several illnesses were potentially tied to formula.
translation.ko: 분유와 연관될 수 있는 질환들이 발견되면서 이뤄졌습니다

translation.en: [reporter 3] A variety of brands of raw cake mix have infected 16 people,
translation.ko: 여러 상표의 케이크 믹스 때문에 16명이 감염되었고

translation.en: one of which developed a type of kidney failure.
[woman 2] We talk about our food supply being the safest in the world,
translation.ko: 우리는 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 공급망을 갖췄다고 하죠

translation.en: and I believe it is.
[reporter 4] People reported getting sick, being hospitalized for liver dysfunction,
translation.ko: 간 기능 부전으로 입원하는 사례 등이 있었고

translation.en: and even having their gallbladders removed in some cases.
[reporter 5] One in four pieces of raw chicken is contaminated with salmonella.
[reporter 6] The CDC announced another E. coli outbreak
translation.ko: 질병통제예방센터의 발표로는 또 다른 대장균 식중독 발생이

translation.en: is impacting romaine lettuce.
We have the safest food supply in the world.
translation.ko: 우리는 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 공급망을 갖췄습니다

translation.en: [reporter 7] Melons from a Colorado farm
are contaminated with what is called "listeria."
[reporter 8] Every four minutes, someone is rushed to the hospital
because the food they ate made them sick.
We must continue to have the safest food supply in the world.
translation.ko: 우리는 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 공급망을 유지해야 합니다

translation.en: Safest food in the world.
[man 1] Safest food supply in the world.
Safest food supply.
[woman 3] Safest food supply in the world.
[man 2] We have the best, most efficient, safest food supply in the entire world.
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 가장 효율적이고 안전한 식품 공급망을 갖췄습니다

translation.en: By golly, we need to keep it that way.
[announcer] Now, live at 11 o'clock.
The warning tonight from health officials here in the Northwest.
translation.ko: 북서부 지역 보건 당국의 권고 사항입니다

translation.en: They say you should be on the lookout for a life-threatening illness
translation.ko: 지역에서 발생 중인 생명을 위협하는 질환을

translation.en: that's cropping up in our area.
Forty-five people are…
[Bill] I actually remember this like it was yesterday.
There was an E. coli outbreak in the state of Washington
linked to something unknown.
translation.ko: 원인은 알려지지 않았죠 "세균성 질환 어린이 수십 명을 덮치다"

translation.en: [man] The whole problem started
when a pediatric infectious-disease specialist called me and said,
translation.ko: 한 소아 감염병 전문가가 전화해서 이러더군요 "존 코바야시, 의학 박사 전 워싱턴주 역학 전문가"

translation.en: "I've got 11 people who I've seen
in about 30 hours with E. coli O157."
I've never seen anything like this before.
And that was a big red light for me
that something bad was going on.
[reporter 1] Seven new cases of E. coli poisoning were confirmed…
translation.ko: 오늘 아침 대장균 식중독 환자가 7명 더 늘었고…

translation.en: [reporter 2] …E. coli patients remain hospitalized.
translation.ko: 대장균 식중독 환자들은 현재 입원 중입니다

translation.en: [reporter 3] There are 21 kids in Western Washington hospitals.
translation.ko: 워싱턴주 서부 지역 병원에 입원한 어린이 환자는 모두 21명입니다

translation.en: Some experts say it's all about to get worse.
translation.ko: 몇몇 전문가들은 더 심각해질 것이라고 합니다

translation.en: [John] We had no idea that it would be
translation.ko: 그때는 몰랐습니다 이것이 미국에서 가장 큰 규모의 식품 매개 질병 사건이 될 줄은요

translation.en: the largest foodborne outbreak in the United States.
translation.ko: 이것이 미국에서 가장 큰 규모의 식품 매개 질병 사건이 될 줄은요

translation.en: [man] I had just transferred from active duty.
translation.ko: 현역 복무 후에 전출된 지 얼마 안 됐을 때였죠

translation.en: I was a nuclear engineer on a submarine in the Navy.
I had a wife.
I had a nine-year-old son and a 16-month-old son at the time.
translation.ko: 그 당시 9살 된 아들과 16개월 된 아들이 있었습니다

translation.en: There had already been some news-- Some rumblings about an E. coli outbreak.
translation.ko: 대장균 식중독이 발생했다는 소식, 소문이 돌긴 했는데 "다린 데트와일러 라일리 데트와일러의 아버지"

translation.en: But it didn't mean anything to me. I never heard of E. coli.
translation.ko: 저한테는 아무 의미가 없었죠 대장균이 뭔지도 몰랐어요

translation.en: "What's the worst that could happen?"
E. coli poisoning is a fairly new illness.
Not much is known about why the bacteria causes some people to get so sick.
translation.ko: 대장균이 질병을 일으키는 이유는 별로 알려진 것이 없습니다

translation.en: Mr. Kobayashi, can you tell us, uh, the concern seems to be with secondary…
translation.ko: 코바야시 씨, 어떤 우려가 있는지 말씀해 주시겠습니까…

translation.en: [John] A big part of the outbreak was explaining what E. coli O157 was.
translation.ko: 대장균 O157이 어떤 건지 설명하는 게 중요한 부분이었어요

translation.en: I felt like I was, uh, Tony Fauci for a couple of weeks. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 그때 한 2주간 제가 앤서니 파우치였던 셈이죠

translation.en: The average incubation period for most, uh, people is three to four days.
The problem is that it can take up to nine days before a person becomes ill.
translation.ko: 문제는 어떤 사람은 9일 만에 발병하기도 한다는 겁니다

translation.en: The mainstay of disease prevention, uh, for this type of illness
translation.ko: 이런 질병을 예방하려면 매우 중요한 것이

translation.en: is thorough washing of hands, uh, either when…
E. coli is a general category of bacteria,
and they're natural inhabitants of everybody's intestines.
There are many, many different kinds of E. coli.
Most don't do any harm at all.
But there are certain ones, like E. coli O157,
translation.ko: 하지만 대장균 O157 같은 특정 종류는

translation.en: that can make you real sick.
Within a couple of days,
it became clear that it was linked to Jack in the Box undercooked hamburgers.
translation.ko: '잭인더박스'의 덜 익은 햄버거와 관련 있다는 게 명백해졌죠 "빌 말러 식품 안전 전문 변호사"

translation.en: More than 150 people have become ill after eating tainted hamburger meat
translation.ko: 150명 이상의 환자가 발생했는데 아이다호주와 워싱턴주의 잭인더박스 체인점에서

translation.en: at Jack in the Box restaurants in Idaho and Washington State.
translation.ko: 아이다호주와 워싱턴주의 잭인더박스 체인점에서 오염된 햄버거 고기를 먹었다고 합니다

translation.en: One child has died.
So one of the big problems with E. coli O157
translation.ko: 대장균 O157의 심각한 문제 중 하나는

translation.en: is they produce what's called a Shiga toxin.
They get into the gut and then start pumping out this toxin,
translation.ko: 장에 들어가면 이 독소를 내뿜기 시작하고

translation.en: and that toxin gets into the blood, and that will kill blood cells,
translation.ko: 독소가 혈액에 들어가 혈액 세포를 파괴합니다

translation.en: and then those lysed blood cells end up causing organ failure,
translation.ko: 이렇게 용해된 혈액 세포가 장기 부전을 일으켜

translation.en: the kidneys to shut down.
And that's how kids die.
There are now more than 312 cases in our state alone.
And today there was another death.
So when the Jack in the Box case hit,
I was my fourth year out of law school.
translation.ko: 저는 로스쿨을 졸업한 지 4년 된 변호사였어요

translation.en: I was 34 years old.
I got a phone call from a former client of mine
who had a friend whose daughter, Brianne Kiner, was in the hospital.
translation.ko: 자기 친구 딸 브리앤 카인더가 병원에 있다는 거예요

translation.en: They asked me to go meet with them.
She'd been hospitalized for, you know, four and a half, five months by then.
translation.ko: 브리앤은 그때 4개월 반 5개월 동안 입원 중이었죠

translation.en: There's so many mechanical things going on
translation.ko: 수많은 기계 장치를 달고 있는 거예요

translation.en: and wires going into her and tubes going into her.
And I walked out of the room. I was crying.
Because it was just really difficult, you know?
It's difficult even today to think about, you know, Brianne in that situation.
translation.ko: 그런 상황에 있던 브리앤을 생각하는 게 지금도 힘들어요

translation.en: You know, she was… she was so vulnerable.
And she just ate a freakin' hamburger.
The board of directors of Jack in the Box is ordering a full investigation
into the deadly mistake.
The investigators and the health department,
they were able to determine that my kid got sick from this other kid at the daycare center.
translation.ko: 제 아이가 어린이집의 다른 애한테서 옮았다고 했습니다

translation.en: [reporter] Children's Hospital is treating 18 children this evening,
translation.ko: 어린이 병원에서 치료 중인 어린이 환자는 현재 18명입니다

translation.en: four of whom got E. coli
not from hamburgers but from someone else,
a secondary infection.
[Darin] All of a sudden, there were two new doctors that came in.
translation.ko: 갑자기 새 의사 두 명이 오더니

translation.en: They announced that they believed
he had developed what's called hemolytic uremic syndrome.
Which essentially is,
when it gets so bad,
the E. coli basically was eating him away from the inside.
translation.ko: 대장균이 우리 애를 몸속에서부터 잡아먹고 있었습니다

translation.en: That it was one organ after another.
I remember saving newspaper clippings, thinking someday I'll be able to
translation.ko: 신문 기사를 스크랩했던 게 생각나네요 언젠가는 그걸 보며

translation.en: communicate with my son and tell him how…
how brave he was
and how proud I was of him.
[reporter] I'd like to introduce Vicki and Darin Detwiler,
whose 16-month-old son remains in critical condition
at Tacoma's Mary Bridge Hospital.
My question to you now is,
what are you prepared to do in regards to the tainted-meat problem?
translation.ko: 오염된 육류 문제에 어떻게 대처하실 건가요?

translation.en: First of all, we've got to make it clear to people who are providing fast food
translation.ko: 우선, 패스트푸드 공급 업체에 분명히 얘기해야겠죠

translation.en: that they've got to do everything they can to comply with our cooking regulations…
translation.ko: 조리 규정을 준수하기 위해 최선을 다해야 하며…

translation.en: [John] The regulation in the United States
was that hamburger should be cooked to at least 140 degrees.
translation.ko: 햄버거는 섭씨 60도 이상에서 조리해야 한다는 것이었죠

translation.en: In Washington State,
we had changed that law to 155 degrees because we noticed
translation.ko: 섭씨 68도 이상으로 법을 바꿨습니다 왜냐하면 O157 식중독에 걸린 많은 이가

translation.en: that many of the people with O157
translation.ko: 왜냐하면 O157 식중독에 걸린 많은 이가

translation.en: had eaten poorly cooked hamburger.
translation.ko: 덜 익은 햄버거를 먹었다는 걸 알았기 때문입니다

translation.en: [reporter] There's been lots of attention on this story,
translation.ko: 이 보도가 엄청난 관심을 끌고 있는데요

translation.en: but I think there is still some confusion.
Was it undercooking or contaminated beef that caused the problem?
translation.ko: 덜 익힌 게 원인인가요? 아니면 오염된 쇠고기 때문인가요?

translation.en: Barry, I think that some of that confusion has been probably from industry statements
translation.ko: 배리, 그런 모호함은 어쩌면 책임을 피하려는

translation.en: trying to avoid some of the blame for this. The answer is both.
translation.ko: 업계의 항변 때문이기도 한데요 정답은 둘 다입니다

translation.en: The company was not following the procedure
translation.ko: 회사가 절차를 따르지 않은 거죠 "매리언 네슬 '안전한 식품' 저자"

translation.en: that was required by the state of Washington,
which the company said they didn't know anything about.
[reporter] Do you believe, in retrospect,
that Jack in the Box chose not to pay attention to certain things, like the law?
No, I don't believe that at all.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 전혀 그렇게 생각 안 합니다

translation.en: We would never choose not to pay attention to the law.
Why… why would a company choose not to pay attention to the law?
[Bill] During discovery, they dumped on me about a million pages of documents.
translation.ko: 조사 중에 회사 측에서 수백만 장의 문건을 넘기더군요

translation.en: I am pretty confident that they thought that I wouldn't go through them,
translation.ko: 제가 그 문건들을 다 보지 못할 거라 생각했겠지만

translation.en: but we started finding things that were really interesting.
translation.ko: 우리는 정말 흥미로운 사항들을 찾아내기 시작했죠

translation.en: An employee of Jack in the Box
sent a letter in the suggestion box to corporate headquarters saying,
translation.ko: 본사 건의함을 통해 이런 편지를 보냈어요

translation.en: "Hey, we're undercooking our hamburgers, and we're having customer complaints."
And then you could see the real paper trail.
translation.ko: 그 외에도 진짜로 증거가 될 만한 문서들을 볼 수 있었죠

translation.en: Not only did they receive the new regulations
from the state of Washington for increased cook times
translation.ko: 워싱턴주의 새로운 규정을 전달받았을 뿐 아니라

translation.en: but that they actually thought about it
and made the decision to essentially ignore it.
Once I had that,
I called up the lawyer for Jack in the Box and said, you know, "You're done."
translation.ko: 잭인더박스의 변호사에게 전화해서 너희는 끝났다고 했죠

translation.en: Jack in the Box now admits it misplaced a Washington State advisory
translation.ko: 잭인더박스가 워싱턴주의 자문을 간과했음을 인정하고 나섰습니다

translation.en: directing that all hamburgers must be cooked at 155 degrees.
translation.ko: 자문의 내용은 모든 햄버거는 68도에서 조리하라는 겁니다

translation.en: Jack in the Box says it found the advisory when…
As a parent, you try to protect your kids.
And then something that's invisible comes along that you don't know about,
translation.ko: 그런데 보이지 않는 뭔가가 나타난 거예요 알지도 못하고 들어본 적도 없는 게요

translation.en: that you've never even heard of. [inhales]
translation.ko: 알지도 못하고 들어본 적도 없는 게요

translation.en: It's so devastating.
Doctor says, "You're gonna ask about second opinion
and third opinion, but there's zero chance of recovery at this point."
translation.ko: '2차 소견, 3차 소견을 물어보시겠지만' '지금으로서는 전혀 회복 가능성이 없습니다'

translation.en: That, uh, "There's been so much organ damage,
and we're not able to get enough oxygen into him
and that the amount of brain damage at this point,
keeping him on life support any longer
would be… abusive."
"It's just… it's not going to do anything."
I asked them to take everything off so I could hold him for a little while.
translation.ko: 잠시 아이를 안아볼 수 있게 모든 걸 떼어 달라고 했어요

translation.en: And I actually had to get Dr. Crane to come and… and check
translation.ko: 크레인 선생님께 확인해 달라고 해야 했죠

translation.en: because somehow I kept thinking that if I just held him close enough,
translation.ko: 계속 이런 생각을 했거든요 아이를 꼭 안아 주면

translation.en: that his heart would keep on beating and that he'd keep on breathing.
translation.ko: 심장이 계속 뛰고 아이가 숨을 계속 쉴 거라고요

translation.en: [Marion] Four children died.
I mean, can you imagine?
They died from a hamburger at Jack in the Box.
If you're the parent of one of those kids, this is beyond your comprehension.
translation.ko: 이 아이들 중 한 명의 부모라면 이해가 안 되는 일이죠

translation.en: And I have to say that E. coli O157 deaths are pretty awful.
translation.ko: 대장균 O157로 인한 죽음은 아주 지독합니다

translation.en: They're not nice deaths.
[Darin] Jack in the Box lawyers met with us and offered us a settlement
translation.ko: 잭인더박스의 변호사들이 저희한테 와서 합의를 제안했어요

translation.en: that included essentially a gag order that we could never talk about it.
translation.ko: 이 사건에 관한 얘기를 절대 못 하는 조건이 들어 있었죠

translation.en: And I had already made the decision that there's no way I was gonna keep quiet for the rest of my life
translation.ko: 저는 평생 입 다물고 살 수는 없다고 마음먹은 참이었습니다

translation.en: about what was the cause of my son's death.
I couldn't handle the idea of not doing anything,
even if that meant that I needed to change careers.
I am a professor and assistant dean
focused on regulatory affairs of food and food industries…
translation.ko: 식품과 식품 산업에 대한 규제에 중점을 두고 있죠…

translation.en: [off camera] I teach about food safety and food policy as a professor.
translation.ko: 저는 교수가 되어 식품 안전과 식품 정책에 관해 가르칩니다

translation.en: I teach grad students.
I had to try to do something to prevent others from being in the same situation.
translation.ko: 사람들이 저와 같은 상황을 겪지 않게 하려면 뭔가를 해야 했죠

translation.en: It's the largest personal injury settlement ever in our state.
translation.ko: 안녕하십니까, 주 사상 최대의 개인 상해 합의가 이뤄졌습니다

translation.en: It looks like the parent company for Jack in the Box restaurants
translation.ko: 잭인더박스의 모기업이 덜 익힌 햄버거를 판 것에 대해

translation.en: will have to pay millions of dollars for serving undercooked hamburgers.
translation.ko: 수백만 달러를 지불해야 할 것 같습니다

translation.en: Settlement is expected to cost Jack in the Box at least $10 million.
translation.ko: 잭인더박스가 부담할 합의금은 최소 1천만 달러 이상입니다

translation.en: $4.4 million.
$15.6 million.
We're very confident that, uh, that money will be sufficient
translation.ko: 저희 생각에는 확실히 이 정도 금액이면 브리앤을 평생 돌보는 데

translation.en: to care for Brianne over the course of her life, however…
[man] Bill Marler not only became the most important attorney
translation.ko: 빌 말러는 가장 중요한 변호사가 되었습니다

translation.en: in terms of handling lawsuits against the companies
that are responsible for those outbreaks,
but he's also become a much larger advocate.
translation.ko: 훨씬 더 열성적인 식품 안전 옹호자가 됐죠

translation.en: I'm tired of visiting with horribly sick kids
translation.ko: 끔찍하게 아픈 아이들을 만나는 것도 이젠 질립니다

translation.en: who did not have to be sick in the first place.
I am outraged…
He has become one of the dominant voices in food safety reform in the United States,
translation.ko: 밥은 미국 식품 안전 개혁의 중요한 대변자가 되었습니다

translation.en: having started out as a plaintiff's attorney.
translation.ko: 민사 소송의 원고 측 변호사로 활동한 이후로요

translation.en: [interviewer] Specific to Jack in the Box, how did the burgers get contaminated?
[hesitates] So, we don't know exactly
how the Jack in the Box hamburger got contaminated,
but, you know, generally, we know how it happens.
It's usually in the slaughter facility.
It's, uh, nicking of a gut of a cow during slaughter.
translation.ko: 소를 도축할 때 내장에 칼자국이 나면요

translation.en: But the whole meat industry was premised on the fact that the slaughterhouses
translation.ko: 하지만 육류 업계 전체가 이런 전제를 갖고 있었어요 도축 업체나 쇠고기 포장 업체는

translation.en: and the beef packers could essentially do whatever they wanted to do.
translation.ko: 도축 업체나 쇠고기 포장 업체는 원하는 대로 작업할 수 있으며

translation.en: And it was up to consumers
to cook the E. coli out of the product.
translation.ko: 조리를 통해 제품에서 대장균을 없애야 한다고요

translation.en: If you buy a piece of steak, that's a piece of meat from one animal.
translation.ko: 스테이크 한 조각을 사면 그건 한 마리에서 나온 고기예요

translation.en: If there is E. coli, it's on the outside. It's not in the middle.
translation.ko: 대장균이 있다면 겉에만 있습니다 고기 속에는 없죠

translation.en: So searing the steak would help kill that.
translation.ko: 그러니 스테이크를 구우면 대장균을 없앨 수 있을 겁니다

translation.en: The problem is that when you buy ground beef,
you now take the outsides, and they're part of the insides.
Not only are you bringing all the animals together and slaughtering them in the same facility,
translation.ko: 한 시설에서 모든 소를 도축할 뿐 아니라

translation.en: now you're taking chunks of multiple animals, and you're grinding them up into one big mess.
translation.ko: 여러 마리에서 떼어낸 고기 조각을 한꺼번에 갈아서 하나로 만듭니다

translation.en: [Marion] Hamburger, sometimes, is the result of mixing meat
translation.ko: 어떤 경우에 햄버거는 400마리에서 나온 고기가 뒤섞여 있을 때도 있어요

translation.en: from as many as 400 animals.
translation.ko: 400마리에서 나온 고기가 뒤섞여 있을 때도 있어요

translation.en: [chuckling] Kind of awful to think about.
If one of those animals has this toxic form of E. coli,
translation.ko: 그중 한 마리에 이런 유독한 대장균이 있다면

translation.en: you're in trouble.
[Bill] In the aftermath of Jack in the Box,
you know, people from USDA met with victims,
and, you know, the Clinton Administration, to their credit,
brought in people who were pretty activist.
Mike?
[Bill] You know, Mike Taylor being one.
We intend to reduce the risk of foodborne illness
translation.ko: 육류 및 가금류 제품을 소비할 때 생길 수 있는

translation.en: associated with the consumption of meat and poultry products
translation.ko: 육류 및 가금류 제품을 소비할 때 생길 수 있는 식품 매개 질병의 위험을 최대한 줄이고자 합니다

translation.en: to the maximum extent possible.
translation.ko: 식품 매개 질병의 위험을 최대한 줄이고자 합니다

translation.en: [assistant] Thank you.
[Mike] The official policy of the USDA was
that this is not the responsibility of the regulatory system or the industry.
translation.ko: 이것은 규제 체계나 업계의 책임이 아니라는 것이었죠

translation.en: Consumers are expected to cook these products and make them safe themselves.
translation.ko: 소비자가 제품을 잘 조리해서 안전하게 섭취해야 한다는 겁니다

translation.en: The bottom line is that raw meat contains bacteria.
And proper cooking kills bacteria.
[Mike] To mothers that lost children,
to people whose families had been harmed by this outbreak,
that was, uh, a shocking and highly unacceptable revelation.
We simply had to take action immediately to try to change the dynamic.
translation.ko: 이런 상황을 바꾸기 위해 즉시 조치를 취해야 했습니다

translation.en: And so I did make the decision that we would declare O157:H7 to be an adulterant,
translation.ko: 그래서 이런 결정을 내렸죠 O157:H7을 불순물로 규정하고

translation.en: and raw ground beef in the marketplace would be deemed illegal,
translation.ko: 이것이 검출된 생분쇄육 판매를 불법으로 간주하기로 했습니다

translation.en: and USDA could take action to remove it quickly from the market.
translation.ko: 농무부도 그런 분쇄육을 시장에서 빨리 제거하는 조치를 취했죠

translation.en: That was a big game changer.
It meant that it can't be in the meat.
translation.ko: O157:H7은 육류에 존재해서는 안 된다는 뜻이었죠

translation.en: If it was in the meat, you had to pull it off the marketplace.
You know, the rates that you see today are very minimal,
and you rarely see an E. coli outbreak involving ground beef,
translation.ko: 분쇄육과 관련된 대장균 식중독은 이제 보기 힘들어졌죠

translation.en: so it's a strong argument of just how much those reforms had an impact.
translation.ko: 그런 정책 개혁이 효과가 있었다는 강력한 근거입니다

translation.en: [Bill] Thirty years ago,
all the work that I did was E. coli cases linked to hamburger.
translation.ko: 제가 맡았던 사건은 전부 햄버거 관련 대장균 사건이었죠

translation.en: [inhales] Today, that's zero.
I mean, it's a success story.
It used to be the biggest E. coli threat was from hamburgers.
So you'd think, "Okay, as long as I don't eat hamburgers, I'm okay."
translation.ko: 그래서 이렇게 생각하실 거예요 '햄버거만 안 먹으면 괜찮아'

translation.en: And the CDC with a warning this afternoon
about an E. coli outbreak linked to baby spinach.
translation.ko: 베이비 시금치로 인한 대장균 식중독을 경고했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 1] Health officials are warning consumers
translation.ko: 보건 당국이 먹지 말라고 경고한 제품은

translation.en: to not eat Josie's Organics organic baby spinach.
translation.ko: 보건 당국이 먹지 말라고 경고한 제품은 조지스 오가닉스의 유기농 베이비 시금치입니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Several cases of E. coli linked to organic power greens.
translation.ko: 대장균 식중독과 연관된 곳은 오가닉 파워 그린스입니다

translation.en: [Christine] And now E. coli is
by far, uh, caused by lettuce more than ground beef.
translation.ko: 쇠고기 분쇄육보다 상추에서 더 많이 발생합니다

translation.en: When you eat a hamburger,
the most dangerous part of that is not the burger.
It's going to be the onion, lettuce, and the tomatoes.
-[birds chirping] -[dog barks]
You know, I've had bad potato salad or something that was, you know…
translation.ko: 상한 감자샐러드 같은 걸 먹으면 식중독에 걸리기도 하잖아요

translation.en: Just food poisoning
translation.ko: "스콧과 캔디 잉버그 부부 스테퍼니 잉버그의 부모"

translation.en: was my idea of what a foodborne illness is.
translation.ko: 제가 생각하는 식품 매개 질병은 그런 거였습니다

translation.en: [Candie] Stephanie came to me, um, the morning we were leaving
and just said, you know, that she was feeling a little…
Having some gas and, you know, a little bit of diarrhea.
But she just thought she was nervous, and we didn't think anything of it at all.
translation.ko: 스테퍼니는 긴장해서 그런 것 같다고 했고 우리도 무슨 일이 생겼다고는 전혀 생각도 못 했죠

translation.en: [Candie] One, two, three.
[pilot] Ladies and gentlemen, let me be the first to welcome you to Punta Cana.
translation.ko: 신사 숙녀 여러분 푼타카나에 오신 것을 환영합니다

translation.en: [Candie] When we got to the Dominican Republic, and we were at the resort,
she felt like she was feeling a little bit better.
translation.ko: 스테퍼니는 조금 나아진 것 같다고 했죠

translation.en: She took a shower.
But throughout the night, it progressed, getting worse and worse,
translation.ko: 하지만 그날 밤 동안 병이 진행돼서 점점 악화됐고

translation.en: and that's when I realized we needed to get some help.
translation.ko: 하지만 그날 밤 동안 병이 진행돼서 점점 악화됐고 그때가 돼서야 도움이 필요하다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: It was an absolute nightmare of tests and doctors.
They kept telling us, "She'll be better. We'll give her these antibiotics."
translation.ko: 의사들은 계속 이랬어요 '괜찮을 겁니다, 항생제를 놨어요'

translation.en: "She has this kind of bug. She'll be back at the resort tomorrow."
And then the next morning,
when they let me go in to see her,
she didn't recognize me.
She was… she was pulling at her hair.
I'm like, "She's having a seizure."
Her kidneys had stopped functioning, and she was having swelling of her brain.
translation.ko: 신장 기능이 정지됐고 뇌가 부풀고 있었습니다

translation.en: They made me leave, and they all rushed in,
and it was just like from a bad… [chuckles, sniffles] A nightmare.
translation.ko: 무슨 나쁜 꿈… 악몽을 꾸는 것 같았죠

translation.en: Uh, the whole thing.
The doctor pulled Candie aside in a hallway
translation.ko: 의사가 캔디를 복도 한쪽으로 불러서 이랬죠

translation.en: and said, you know, "You got to get her out of here."
I immediately went home and contacted, you know, over a dozen, uh, medevac, uh, operations
and found one that was gonna get her out immediately.
translation.ko: 한 곳과 연락이 닿아서 스테퍼니를 즉시 옮겼어요

translation.en: [Candie] It was then that next morning
that they found the Shiga toxins in her system
to be able to say it was definitely from E. coli.
They said, "She might not make it through the night."
"Get your son back from San Francisco."
A priest was there within a couple hours to give her last rites.
translation.ko: 두 시간쯤 있다가 신부님이 종부 성사를 하러 오셨죠

translation.en: [man] Stephanie's condition rapidly deteriorated overnight
translation.ko: 스테퍼니의 상태는 하룻밤 사이에 급격히 악화됐어요

translation.en: in a very critical condition.
I think she had a few more hours to live, unfortunately.
translation.ko: 안타깝지만 몇 시간 못 살겠구나 싶었습니다

translation.en: It is a very scary, uh, situation where you have a perfectly healthy,
translation.ko: 정말 무서웠어요 아주 건강하고 튼튼한 17세 여성이

translation.en: athletic 17-year-old female that goes on spring break,
translation.ko: 아주 건강하고 튼튼한 17세 여성이 봄 방학을 맞아 여행을 떠난 지

translation.en: and 48 hours later, she's dying.
[Scott] Stephanie had an infectious disease doctor
who had us, I mean, basically, "Collect what you can."
translation.ko: 모을 수 있는 것은 다 모으라고 했어요

translation.en: "Talk to all her friends."
"Go through her bank statements to find out what she ate."
translation.ko: 스테퍼니가 무엇을 먹었는지 은행 입출금 명세서를 확인했죠

translation.en: 'Cause we're thinking whatever she-- This may play a role in saving her life.
translation.ko: 이렇게 생각했어요, 스테퍼니가… 이거면 스테퍼니를 살릴 수 있다

translation.en: So we were thorough, thorough to find out everything, you know, she ate over the, you know, previous week or two.
translation.ko: 그래서 지난 1, 2주간 먹은 모든 것을 샅샅이 뒤졌습니다

translation.en: Her friend who she ate at Panera with sent us a snapshot…
translation.ko: 스테퍼니와 파네라에서 같이 식사했던 친구가 간판 사진을 보내줬어요

translation.en: …of a sign.
It wasn't until then that we put two and two together. "Romaine lettuce?"
translation.ko: 그제야 원인을 찾을 수 있었죠 로메인상추였어요 "애리조나주 유마에서 재배된 로메인상추 판매 중지를 권고"

translation.en: [reporter 1] Dozens of people have ended up in the hospital with possible cases of E. coli.
translation.ko: 대장균 식중독으로 보이는 병으로 수십 명이 병원에 입원했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Ninety-eight people from 22 different states,
making this the biggest multistate E. coli outbreak in at least 12 years.
translation.ko: 여러 주에 걸쳐 발생한 대장균 식중독으로는 최근 12년간 최대 규모입니다

translation.en: [reporter 3] The affected region is Yuma, Arizona.
[woman] Most of the lettuce that we eat in the United States
translation.ko: 미국에서 먹는 상추의 대부분은 두 곳에서 나옵니다

translation.en: comes from two places.
translation.ko: 미국에서 먹는 상추의 대부분은 두 곳에서 나옵니다 "캘리포니아주 센트럴밸리"

translation.en: It comes from California's Central Valley, and it comes from Yuma, Arizona.
[Bill] The US is one of the top producers and exporters of leafy greens.
translation.ko: 미국은 잎채소를 가장 많이 생산하고 수출하는 나라 중 하나죠

translation.en: So that means that the lettuce grown in Yuma and in Salinas
is shipped all over the world.
translation.ko: 전 세계로 보내집니다 "대만, 캐나다, 쿠웨이트 일본, 멕시코, 도미니카공화국"

translation.en: We're in a global food system
translation.ko: 우리는 글로벌 식품 체계 속에 살고 있습니다

translation.en: where we're importing and exporting food all over the place.
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 수입하고 전 세계에 수출합니다

translation.en: So problems that occur here can certainly be exported elsewhere.
translation.ko: 미국에서 일어나는 문제가 다른 곳에 전파될 수도 있죠

translation.en: Bacteria don't care about borders.
They don't care about import and export restrictions.
[woman] Consumers don't cook lettuce.
There's no way to control that risk in our kitchen. We eat it fresh.
translation.ko: 주방에서 통제할 수 없는 위험이죠 생으로 먹으니까요

translation.en: [Darin] So there's no kill step.
You can clean it, but you're still not truly killing.
translation.ko: 씻을 수는 있지만 제대로 살균이 안 되죠

translation.en: [Bill] And "organic" only means that it uses less chemicals, pesticides.
translation.ko: '유기농'이란 화학 물질과 살충제를 덜 썼다는 뜻일 뿐이죠

translation.en: Organic simply doesn't mean pathogen-free.
Explain how we get E. coli in greens.
translation.ko: 어떻게 채소에 대장균이 생기는지 설명해 주세요

translation.en: Right. So it's actually not the lettuce's fault.
-[Rachael] That's right. It really isn't. -It's the livestock.
[Lance] How we raise animals can fuel the growth of these bugs.
translation.ko: 가축을 키우는 방식 때문에 이런 세균이 쉽게 자라는 거예요

translation.en: So if we crowd the animals together,
and you have one that's carrying a really bad pathogen like E. coli O157,
translation.ko: 한 마리가 대장균 O157 같은 나쁜 병원균을 지녔다면

translation.en: then they can poop those bacteria out.
translation.ko: 그런 세균이 대변을 통해 나오게 됩니다

translation.en: And then, the shit from the cattle washes off
translation.ko: 가축의 대변이 하천이나 관개 수로로 흘러들고

translation.en: into the streams or into canals, irrigation canals,
and then those can be used to water these plants.
translation.ko: 그 물이 채소에 물을 주는 데 사용될 수 있습니다

translation.en: You have this distribution system
for these pathogens from animals to produce.
[Marion] The regulation of animal waste is minimal.
translation.ko: 가축 분뇨에 관한 규제는 아주 적습니다

translation.en: We have laws on the books, but they're not enforced.
That is an American scandal.
[Bill] What got Stephanie sick was romaine lettuce grown in Yuma, Arizona,
translation.ko: 스테퍼니가 아팠던 것은 애리조나주 유마에서 재배한 로메인상추 때문이었죠

translation.en: specifically in the Wellton Canal area,
which happens to run right past the concentrated feedlots.
translation.ko: 이 운하는 공교롭게도 밀집형 축사가 있는 곳을 지나죠

translation.en: Those are land-use issues that,
I think, are the things that FDA, USDA, the federal government, state governments,
translation.ko: 식품의약국, 농무부 연방 정부, 주 정부

translation.en: Environmental Protection Agency,
all of those entities haven't kind of come to grips with that yet.
translation.ko: 모든 곳에서 아직도 제대로 대처하지 못하고 있습니다

translation.en: [Lance] There are 15 federal agencies that in one form or another,
are tasked with food safety regulation.
translation.ko: 이런저런 형태의 연방 기관 15개가 식품 안전 규제를 담당합니다

translation.en: [Bill] The USDA primarily deals with meat.
They were at the helm of the Jack in the Box E. coli case.
And the FDA deals with leafy greens, like romaine and spinach.
translation.ko: 그리고 식품의약국은 로메인과 시금치 같은 잎채소를 다루죠

translation.en: -[assistant] Go ahead. -[woman] Nice to meet you.
-Do you care which side? You pick. -[woman] No. I don't.
Okay, I'll sit over here.
[grunts] Great.
[interviewer] Okay, we ready?
What falls under your jurisdiction? What falls under your jurisdiction?
translation.ko: 관할이 어떻게 되는지 각자 말씀해 주세요

translation.en: Sure, I'll start.
USDA regulates meat and poultry products, egg products, and catfish.
translation.ko: 미국 농무부는 육류 및 가금류 계란, 메기를 규제합니다

translation.en: And the FDA regulates, uh, all foods involved in interstate commerce
translation.ko: 미국 식품의약국은 주 사이에 상업적으로 거래되는 식품 중

translation.en: that Sandy didn't mention, so it's about 80% of the US food system.
translation.ko: 샌드라가 얘기 안 한 모든 식품을 규제하죠 미국 식품 체계의 약 80%를 차지합니다

translation.en: It's a large responsibility and one that we take very seriously.
translation.ko: 큰 책임을 지고 있죠 아주 진지하게 생각하고 있습니다

translation.en: The regulatory framework
we have in the world of food safety is pretty complicated.
Let's say you have a beef taco that's made in a restaurant.
translation.ko: 식당에서 만드는 비프타코를 예로 들어 보죠

translation.en: So the beef, well, that's a USDA-regulated food.
Cheese and any of the pico de gallo that's on top of that,
those are FDA-regulated foods.
All of the making of that taco, well, that's happening in a restaurant
translation.ko: 이 타코를 만드는 행위는 식당에서 이뤄지므로 지역 보건 당국이 규제하죠

translation.en: that's regulated by the local health department.
translation.ko: 식당에서 이뤄지므로 지역 보건 당국이 규제하죠

translation.en: So it's a really complicated process.
There's lots of different fingers that can be touching regulatory on that taco.
translation.ko: 타코에 관한 규제를 건드릴 수 있는 사람이 아주 많죠

translation.en: When there's a foodborne illness outbreak,
no single agency is responsible.
translation.ko: "로사 델라우로 미국 하원 의원(민주, 코네티컷)" 책임지는 기관이 전혀 없습니다

translation.en: So there's a lot of finger-pointing.
[interviewer] Ms. Eskin, does the USDA do anything on these cattle operations
translation.ko: 에스킨 씨, 농무부는 가축 분뇨가 관개용수에 섞여 들어가지 않도록

translation.en: to make sure animal waste isn't getting into the irrigation water?
We have no direct authority on any of the production pieces of food animals…
translation.ko: 저희는 식용 동물의 생산에 관한 직접적인 권한이 없습니다…

translation.en: We are doing the best that we can do with our authorities…
translation.ko: 우리의 권한으로 할 수 있는 최선을 다하고 있습니다…

translation.en: We don't have that authority… We do not have authority…
Authority we have or don't have…
[interviewer] Feels like a gap in the system. Does it not?
translation.ko: 체계에 허점이 있는 것 같은데 안 그런가요?

translation.en: I think that's a question you need to ask Congress…
translation.ko: 그런 질문은 의회에 하셔야 할 것 같습니다

translation.en: That's Congress's decision…
The inspection process has to be raised with Congress…
It's not for us to say.
It's really something that has to come from Congress.
translation.ko: 그건 정말 의회에서 해줘야 하는 일입니다

translation.en: [interviewer] To your response that it's a question for Congress,
would you support legislation that gave USDA jurisdiction on the farm?
translation.ko: 농무부에 농장에 대한 관할권을 주는 입법을 지지하시나요?

translation.en: I'm not in a position to endorse legislation.
translation.ko: 저는 입법을 지지할 수 있는 자리에 있는 사람이 아니라서요

translation.en: As the regulatory body, that's not our lane.
translation.ko: 규제 당국으로서 그건 저희 일이 아닙니다

translation.en: [interviewer] Mr. Yiannas, what is the FDA doing to solve the problem,
translation.ko: 야나스 씨, 문제 해결을 위해 식품의약국은 무엇을 하고 있으며

translation.en: and should consumers be satisfied?
We believe that the FDA, as well as the entire food industry,
translation.ko: 저희는 식품의약국뿐 아니라 전체 식품 업계와

translation.en: the fresh leafy green industry, can and must do more.
translation.ko: 잎채소 업계가 더 노력할 수 있고 노력해야 한다고 생각합니다

translation.en: Let me stress, must do more.
Growers have a responsibility,
the primary responsibility to understand whether their products
translation.ko: 재배 업체에 일차적인 책임이 있어요 생산물이 오염될 수 있음을 알고

translation.en: can be contaminated and take measures to mitigate those risks.
translation.ko: 생산물이 오염될 수 있음을 알고 그런 위험을 줄일 조치를 취해야죠

translation.en: [Tim] My name is Tim York. T-I-M Y-O-R-K
[interviewer] How should I title you for your position? Uh, CEO.
-[interviewer] Of? -LGMA.
LGMA stands for Leafy Greens Marketing Agreement.
We were started in 2007 to, uh, ensure safety in lettuce and leafy greens.
translation.ko: 저희는 2007년에 설립됐습니다 상추와 잎채소의 안전을 확보하기 위해서요

translation.en: [interviewer] What are some of the more recognizable handlers
that are part of the LGMA that we might know?
translation.ko: LGMA 회원이면서 유명한 업체들이 있을까요? 저희가 알 만한 곳이요

translation.en: Members of LGMA would include Dole, Fresh Express,
Ready Pac, Taylor Farms, uh, Organic Girl.
Those are all names you probably see on the retail shelf of packaged salads.
translation.ko: 소매점의 포장 샐러드 코너에서 볼 수 있는 업체들이죠

translation.en: [Sarah] The Leafy Greens Marketing Agreements
were formed in response to the 2006 spinach outbreak.
translation.ko: 잎채소마케팅협약이 만들어진 것은 2006년 시금치 식중독 사태에 대응하기 위해서였죠

translation.en: Feds have a new warning about spinach.
translation.ko: 연방 정부가 시금치 경보를 새로 내렸습니다

translation.en: They want you to stay away from all spinach, not just the bagged produce.
translation.ko: 봉지에 든 제품뿐 아니라 모든 시금치를 먹지 말라고 합니다

translation.en: We're talking about hundreds of bags of raw spinach out here.
Now, no one is eating raw spinach, and all of it is going in the garbage.
translation.ko: 아무도 생시금치를 먹지 않아서 모두 폐기 처분 될 예정입니다

translation.en: [reporter] This is the same deadly strain of E. coli
that we saw in the Jack in the Box outbreak.
[Timothy] The industry was terrorized.
They worried that if this were to occur again and again and again,
translation.ko: 이런 일이 계속 반복해서 일어날까 봐 걱정했죠

translation.en: if they didn't get to the bottom of this problem,
that it would essentially destroy the California leafy greens industry.
translation.ko: 캘리포니아주의 잎채소 산업이 근본적으로 파괴될 수 있다는 걸요

translation.en: The spinach outbreak of 2006
translation.ko: 2006년의 시금치 사태는 업계의 분수령 역할을 했죠

translation.en: was a watershed moment for the industry because that was really the first time
translation.ko: 2006년의 시금치 사태는 업계의 분수령 역할을 했죠 그때 처음으로

translation.en: that we were aware of how our practices affected people.
translation.ko: 우리의 관행이 사람들에게 어떤 영향을 미치는지 알게 됐죠

translation.en: How do pathogens move?
We look at a number of things.
One of them being water.
One of them being proximity to other operations.
One of them would be the sanitation practices
and how they handle machinery and equipment on the farm.
translation.ko: 농장에서 기계와 장비를 어떻게 다루는지도 조사하죠

translation.en: [Bill] I think it's just been really a matter
of the industry sort of does a whack-a-mole.
translation.ko: 일종의 두더지 잡기 게임을 하는 것 같아요

translation.en: "Oh, we'll do testing."
"Oh, we'll make everybody wear a hairnet."
But they just don't want to come to grips with the fact that the big problem is
translation.ko: 하지만 중요한 문제를 제대로 다루려고 하지 않아요

translation.en: cattle farms and feedlots in close proximity
to where you're growing leafy greens.
[interviewer] How often do your members test their irrigation water?
I don't honestly know the answer to that question. Um…
Irrigation water is required to be tested on an ongoing basis
to know that that is meeting our practices.
[Bill] You know, some of the work the LGMA has done has been admirable.
translation.ko: LGMA가 해온 어떤 일들은 칭찬받을 만합니다

translation.en: But in my view,
it's a way to make sure that the government, uh, doesn't enforce rules on them they don't really like.
translation.ko: 업체들이 원치 않는 규제가 시행되지 않게 하려는 거예요

translation.en: One of the ways to avoid government regulation is to say, "We'll regulate ourselves."
translation.ko: 정부의 규제를 피하고자 스스로 규제하겠다고 하는 거죠

translation.en: [splutters] I honestly don't know what action
the government was potentially going to take if we didn't.
translation.ko: 정부가 어떤 조치를 취하려고 했을지 몰라요

translation.en: But the reason the LGMA was formed is
because we could do that so much faster than the government.
translation.ko: 정부보다 우리가 훨씬 더 빨리할 수 있기 때문이죠

translation.en: [Mike] Who do you hold accountable for fixing this?
translation.ko: 누가 이런 상황을 책임지고 해결하려 하겠어요?

translation.en: The growers don't control the practices of the cattlemen.
The cattlemen, you know, feel that they're not responsible for produce safety.
translation.ko: 축산업체는 농산물 안전에 자기들 책임이 없다고 생각하죠

translation.en: There's not enough impetus for people to break out of their silos
translation.ko: 각자 자신의 영역을 깨고 나와 이렇게 얘기할 만한 이유가 없죠

translation.en: and say, "We've got to come up with a solution that figures out,
translation.ko: '이 상황을 개선하기 위해 해결책을 제시해야 합니다'

translation.en: how can you use vaccines to make this better?"
"How can you adjust the cattle feed to reduce the E. coli?"
And that… you know, my frustration is that's not happening,
translation.ko: 그런 일은 일어나지 않는다는 게 실망스러운 점이에요

translation.en: and people are getting sick, and that's, uh… you know, that's sad.
translation.ko: 사람들은 계속 병에 걸리고요 슬픈 일이죠

translation.en: That's disturbing.
[Bill] In my 30 years of experience doing this,
most companies don't want to, obviously, see me show up at their doorstep.
translation.ko: 대부분의 회사는 제가 나타나는 것을 원하지 않아요

translation.en: You know, the Leafy Green Marketing Agreement, they're trying to do the right thing.
translation.ko: 잎채소마케팅협약은 옳은 일을 하려고 노력하고 있어요

translation.en: They're just not going the full distance that I think they should go.
[inhales] You know, these outbreaks at Jack in the Box,
they didn't intend that to happen,
but I kind of put those folks in a different category
than I would the folks from Peanut Corporation of America.
[reporter 1] Food and Drug Administration is advising Americans not to eat
any products made with peanut butter or peanut paste.
translation.ko: 땅콩버터나 땅콩 페이스트가 들어간 제품은 전부 먹지 마세요

translation.en: [reporter 2] More than 500 people have gotten sick in the outbreak,
translation.ko: 이번 식중독 발생으로 500명 이상이 병에 걸렸고

translation.en: and at least eight may have died as a result of salmonella infection.
[Bill] This was an enormous salmonella outbreak.
[reporter 3] Officials are focusing on peanut products
produced by this Georgia plant owned by Peanut Corporation of America.
translation.ko: 아메리카땅콩회사 소유의 조지아 공장 생산 제품입니다

translation.en: [Mike] The Peanut Corporation of America was a major peanut product producer.
They provided peanut paste and peanut products
to hundreds of different major brands in the United States.
translation.ko: 미국의 수백 개 주요 브랜드에 공급했죠

translation.en: [man] Chips Deluxe with peanut butter cups.
-[boy] Peanut butter cups? No way. -[man] Way.
translation.ko: - 땅콩버터 초콜릿? 말도 안 돼 - 말 돼

translation.en: I started working at Peanut Corp in July 2006.
translation.ko: 아메리카땅콩회사에서 2006년 7월부터 일했습니다 "케네스 켄드릭 아메리카땅콩회사 내부 고발자"

translation.en: I could tell things were going to go bad.
translation.ko: "케네스 켄드릭 아메리카땅콩회사 내부 고발자" 상황이 심각해지리라는 것은 분명히 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: The things that had concerned me were, number one, the roof leak.
translation.ko: 제가 걱정했던 것들이 있는데요 먼저, 지붕이 새고 있었어요

translation.en: Because that washes in bird crap,
translation.ko: 새똥이 빗물에 섞여 들어올 수 있고

translation.en: which can bring in a whole host of disease into the plant.
translation.ko: 그러면 온갖 질병의 숙주가 공장에 들어오게 되니까요

translation.en: And the pest control person that brought in to my attention the mice problem.
translation.ko: 또한 해충 방제 담당이 쥐 문제를 지적했어요

translation.en: [man] There are some rats, uh, and they're still alive.
translation.ko: 공장에 쥐가 있습니다 아직도 살아 있어요

translation.en: [Kenneth] The first time I had brought up, uh, concerns to Stewart Parnell, the owner,
translation.ko: 회사 소유주인 스튜어트 파넬에게 맨 처음 이런 우려를 제기하자

translation.en: he told me to shut up and not worry about it,
that they had recall insurance and just go on doing my job.
translation.ko: 리콜 보험이 있으니까 그냥 할 일이나 하라고 했죠

translation.en: Stewart Parnell not only grossly underestimated
translation.ko: 스튜어트 파넬은 식품 안전을 심각하게 과소평가했을 뿐 아니라

translation.en: food safety as a CEO of a food company,
translation.ko: 식품 안전을 심각하게 과소평가했을 뿐 아니라 식품 회사 CEO로서

translation.en: but he blatantly and even flagrantly
just didn't care.
[man] And here we have another live rat.
translation.ko: 여기 또 살아 있는 쥐가 있네요

translation.en: [Bill] Ultimately, what happened was that some of the large companies
that were getting their product from PCA had requirements,
contractual requirements to test the product before it was shipped.
translation.ko: 사전에 제품을 검사해야 한다는 계약상 의무가 있었습니다

translation.en: And they were supposed to give those companies a piece of paper
called a certificate of analysis that said the product was tested
translation.ko: 그게 바로 분석 증명서예요 제품을 검사해서

translation.en: and it's free of pathogens or likely free of pathogens.
translation.ko: 병원균이 없거나 없을 가능성이 높다고 하는 거죠

translation.en: [Marion] And lo and behold,
they had a test that came out positive for the toxic salmonella.
Well, what they ended up doing was retesting until they got a negative test.
translation.ko: 그 사람들은 음성이 나올 때까지 계속 재검사했어요

translation.en: [Bill] Then it got to the point where all of them were positive,
and then they just started forging the certificates of analysis,
saying they were negative.
[Darin] The QA manager,
there's a reason why she has the nickname "the Queen of Liquid Paper."
If they didn't have the results that they needed,
they would literally take old results,
Liquid Paper over the date, and change the date
to make it look like it's a more recent date.
Stewart Parnell told the manager in an email to ship the peanut mill.
translation.ko: 스튜어트 파넬이 공장장에게 땅콩 분쇄기를 보내라는 이메일을 보냈습니다

translation.en: And the manager said,
"Well, I've got to spray off the rat shit and dirt before I can do anything."
Stewart said, "Well, then clean it up and ship it."
There were lots of emails.
And they had emails from the heads of the company saying,
"Oh, you've got a positive salmonella test." "Ship it out anyway."
A salmonella outbreak involving products made with peanut butter is worsening.
translation.ko: 땅콩버터 사용 제품으로 인한 살모넬라균 식중독 사태가 악화되고 있습니다

translation.en: These were recalled too.
The list of items is so long, Campbell, I can't even read them all right now.
translation.ko: 목록이 너무 길어서요, 캠벨 지금 다 읽을 수가 없네요

translation.en: [Bill] It was over 3,000, almost 4,000,
different products got recalled.
[man] Here we go with another pallet. I think this is number six.
translation.ko: 팰릿이 또 하나 있네요 이게 6번일 겁니다

translation.en: It's still sealed.
translation.ko: "PCA 사태로 미국 역사상 최대 규모의 리콜이 실시됐다"

translation.en: I emailed the Texas Department of Agriculture, the FDA.
I… I must have sent a hundred emails.
[reporter] Product recalls continue mounting.
Nobody else was gonna stop them from killing people.
translation.ko: 사장이 사람들을 죽이는 걸 아무도 막으려 하지 않았습니다

translation.en: So somebody had to step up.
He went to the federal government and started, you know, saying how bad the plant was.
translation.ko: 케네스는 연방 정부에 가서 공장이 얼마나 심각한지 증언했죠

translation.en: The White House today called the plant's performance alarming
and promised tougher regulation over America's food supply.
translation.ko: 미국의 식품 공급 체계에 대한 더 강한 규제를 약속했습니다

translation.en: At bare minimum, we should be able to count on our government
translation.ko: 최소한, 정부가 땅콩버터를 먹는 어린이들의 안전을

translation.en: keeping our kids safe when they eat peanut butter.
That's what Sasha eats for, uh… for lunch probably three times a week.
translation.ko: 제 딸 사샤도 일주일에 세 번은 점심때 땅콩버터를 먹어요

translation.en: [representative] Mr. Parnell, Mr. Lightsey, let me just cut to the chase then.
translation.ko: 파넬 씨, 라이트시 씨 바로 본론으로 들어가죠

translation.en: In this container are products that have your ingredients in them.
translation.ko: 이 용기 안의 제품에는 여러분이 만든 재료가 들어갑니다

translation.en: I just wonder, would either of you be willing to take the lid off
translation.ko: 두 분 중에 이 속에 든 제품을

translation.en: and eat any of these products now?
translation.ko: 두 분 중에 이 속에 든 제품을 먹어 볼 분이 있을까요?

translation.en: Mr. Chairman, and members of the committee,
on the advice of my counsel,
I respectfully decline to answer your question
based on the protection afforded me under the United States Constitution.
translation.ko: 미국 헌법에 따라 부여된 방어권을 쓰겠습니다

translation.en: [Greg] You're dismissed.
Sometimes manufacturers of food don't really think of it as food.
translation.ko: 제조업자들은 식품을 식품으로 생각 안 할 때가 있어요

translation.en: It becomes a… a commodity.
So they don't think about it in the sense of, "Oh, my goodness,
this is going to go into somebody's mouth and into their stomach."
translation.ko: '이건 누군가의 입을 통해서 배 속으로 들어갈 거잖아'

translation.en: My father was a highly decorated Korean War veteran
translation.ko: 제 아버지는 훈장을 많이 받은 한국 전쟁 참전용사십니다

translation.en: and was awarded three Purple Hearts for his valor.
translation.ko: 용맹함을 인정받아 퍼플하트 훈장을 세 개 받으셨어요

translation.en: His final battle occurred when he ate some contaminated peanut butter from PCA.
translation.ko: 아버지의 마지막 전투는 아메리카땅콩회사가 만든 오염된 땅콩버터를 드시면서 시작됐습니다

translation.en: [Christine] When you spend time with these victims and speak with them,
they don't get over it.
It's not a natural form of grief
when someone you love dies from, um, a bunch of peanut butter crackers.
translation.ko: 땅콩버터 크래커 때문에 사랑하는 이가 죽었다면요

translation.en: Our family feels cheated. My mom should be here today.
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 사기당한 기분입니다 제 어머니는 여기 살아계셔야 해요

translation.en: [Timothy] The FDA partnered with the Department of Justice,
and they brought felony counts against Stewart Parnell and his associates
translation.ko: 스튜어트 파넬과 그의 공범들을 중죄 혐의로 고발했습니다

translation.en: for knowingly and intentionally shipping contaminated products
translation.ko: 알면서 의도적으로 유독한 살모넬라균 오염 제품을

translation.en: that had toxic salmonella into the stream of commerce.
[reporter 1] Stewart Parnell, he is sentenced yesterday to 28 years behind bars.
[reporter 2] Eight people died, sir. Do you have anything to say to their families?
translation.ko: 여덟 명이 죽었습니다 희생자 가족에게 하실 말씀은요?

translation.en: [Kenneth] It doesn't bother him to this day because he's still appealing.
translation.ko: 지금도 전혀 신경을 안 쓰고 있죠 여전히 항소 중이거든요

translation.en: "Murdering people is okay."
And I'm sorry. I call this murder.
He knew that there was salmonella in there.
translation.ko: 스튜어트는 살모넬라균이 있다는 사실을 알고 있었어요

translation.en: So, you know, Stewart,
why would you ship that knowing you could kill people?
translation.ko: 사람이 죽을 수도 있다는 걸 알면서 왜 보내라고 한 거죠?

translation.en: Explain to the families.
Criminal prosecution is appropriate when it comes to really bad actors.
translation.ko: 진짜 악당에 대해서는 형사 소추를 하는 게 맞습니다

translation.en: People like Stewart Parnell, who knowingly sold contaminated product,
translation.ko: 고의로 오염된 제품을 판 스튜어트 파넬이나

translation.en: or Jack DeCoster, the Egg King.
[reporter 1] Salmonella outbreaks sickening hundreds
translation.ko: 수백 명의 환자를 낸 살모넬라균 식중독 사태는

translation.en: have led to a national egg recall.
[reporter 2] The numbers are enough to give anyone shell shock.
The recall has grown to more than 500 million eggs
from just two farms in Iowa.
translation.ko: 모두 아이오와주의 두 농장에서 나온 겁니다

translation.en: The chairman and owner, Austin Jack DeCoster.
translation.ko: 회장 겸 소유주는 오스틴 잭 디코스터죠

translation.en: [Christine] Jack DeCoster is a businessman
who's been in the farming industry for easily 50 years.
And in place after place and time after time,
he has run filthy farms.
[Bill] He knew that their product was being produced
translation.ko: 자기네 농장의 생산물이 아주 비위생적인 환경에서

translation.en: in really insanitary conditions
that likely would have resulted in eggs being contaminated.
A pile of manure at one of them, eight feet high.
translation.ko: 그중 한 곳에는 거름이 쌓여 있었는데 높이가 2.5m쯤 됐습니다

translation.en: Pile of manure, eight feet high, leaking!
As many as 56,000 Americans were sickened because of it.
How is it possible that after all this time,
translation.ko: 시간이 이렇게 많이 흘렀는데 어떻게 또다시

translation.en: we have another DeCoster egg producer involved in a half-billion-dollar recall?
translation.ko: 디코스터 계란 생산업체가 5억 달러어치 리콜을 하게 됐죠?

translation.en: -[cup clattering] -[clicks tongue]
Well, the question is complicated, so--
[Christine] For decades he got away with it.
But he finally was convicted and, um, was given a short prison term.
translation.ko: 하지만 결국 유죄가 인정돼 짧은 징역형을 받았습니다

translation.en: [Darin] There will never be an end to bad actors
who decide that profit is more important than ethics.
translation.ko: 윤리보다 이윤을 더 중요하게 생각하는 사람들이죠

translation.en: We have laws.
We have regulatory authorities and regulatory agencies,
and these things still happen, even today.
translation.ko: 그런데 이런 일들이 지금도 일어나고 있어요

translation.en: [Bill] Come on, guys.
Come on, come on.
After the Wright County egg outbreak,
translation.ko: 라이트 카운티 계란 식중독 사태 후에

translation.en: I wound up on Larry King Live, talking about, you know, foodborne illness again.
translation.ko: '래리 킹 라이브'에 나가서 식품 매개 질병에 관해 얘기했죠

translation.en: And sort of at the end of the segment,
I just said, "I'm gonna get chickens," as just sort of a throwaway line.
translation.ko: '닭을 직접 키울 겁니다'라고 별 뜻 없이 얘기했습니다

translation.en: When I got home, my youngest daughter was like, "Oh, so we're gonna get chickens."
translation.ko: 집에 왔더니 막내딸이 이래요 '그럼 우리 닭 키우는 거네요'

translation.en: So now we have chickens,
and now she's off at college, and we still have chickens.
translation.ko: 막내딸은 대학에 다니고 있지만 저희는 여전히 닭을 키우죠

translation.en: More people are becoming sick from a salmonella outbreak.
-Salmonella outbreak. -[reporter 1] Salmonella outbreak.
-Salmonella outbreak. -Large salmonella outbreak.
[reporter 2] More than 100 people have been sent to the hospital.
-[reporter 3] Three hundred cases. -[reporter 4] Made 278 people ill.
At age two, I was hospitalized for 11 days, uh, in New Haven.
Uh, my folks-- It was an isolation. My folks couldn't come to see me.
translation.ko: 가족들은… 제가 격리 상태라서 저를 보러 올 수가 없었죠

translation.en: [splutters] You know, so I am a survivor of salmonella.
Uh, and it's… uh, it's a killer.
[Sarah] If you look at the two bacteria that are most likely
to send you to the hospital from food,
it's salmonella and a germ called campylobacter.
And if you look at the foods that are most likely to be the source for those bacteria,
translation.ko: 이런 세균의 원천이 될 수 있는 음식은

translation.en: at least from the outbreak data, it's chicken.
And so if we want to address foodborne illness,
we wanna bring those numbers down, chicken is the place to start.
translation.ko: 발생 횟수를 줄이고 싶다면 닭고기에서부터 시작해야 합니다

translation.en: Four companies now control more than half the market in chicken processing.
translation.ko: 닭고기 가공 시장의 절반 이상을 4개 회사가 좌지우지합니다

translation.en: So it's a very consolidated industry,
and it means those companies have a lot of control over our food.
translation.ko: 이런 회사들이 우리의 음식을 좌지우지한다는 거죠

translation.en: At the top, the very top of the chain,
there are really just two breeders controlling the entire poultry supply
translation.ko: 전체 가금류 공급을 통제하는 사육업체는 단 둘뿐입니다

translation.en: in the sense that they provide the eggs.
And those companies largely operate in secrecy.
Their customers are not the public. They're not very communicative.
translation.ko: 고객사를 공개하지 않습니다 외부와 소통을 잘 안 해요

translation.en: And it's very hard to tell what practices they're using
translation.ko: 계란이 병을 퍼뜨리지 않도록 어떤 방법을 쓰는지

translation.en: to keep those eggs from spreading disease.
Perdue is very focused on food safety,
translation.ko: 퍼듀에서는 식품 안전을 위해 많이 노력하고 있습니다

translation.en: and, um, what makes us a little bit different,
I believe, it came from, uh, the "no antibiotics ever" move.
Well, tonight, there's a major change coming to your dinner table.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤, 저녁 식탁에 중요한 변화가 생겼습니다

translation.en: Perdue, the chicken makers, say it's dropping most human antibiotics
translation.ko: 닭고기 생산업체 퍼듀는 자사의 닭고기 제품에서

translation.en: from its chicken products.
[Bruce] In order to do that, we needed to change a lot of things about how we raise chickens.
translation.ko: 그러기 위해 닭을 키우는 방법을 많이 바꾸어야 했습니다

translation.en: Perdue produces a little over 12 million chickens a week.
translation.ko: 퍼듀는 일주일에 1,200만 개가 넘는 닭고기를 생산합니다

translation.en: So the eggs come in.
Uh, we want to get them to the hatchery as fast as we can.
Make sure that they're in a clean environment.
[Bruce in scene] We asked them, the farmer,
if there are some eggs that are more likely to be dirty,
put them on the bottom.
We've been using this tool. We can swab a lot of eggs
translation.ko: 이런 도구를 사용합니다 많은 수의 계란을 면봉으로 닦아서 즉시 피드백을 확인하죠

translation.en: and get immediate feedback
translation.ko: 많은 수의 계란을 면봉으로 닦아서 즉시 피드백을 확인하죠

translation.en: on how much material is on
and how much organic material is alive on the egg.
translation.ko: 계란 껍데기에 얼마나 많은 유기물이 살아 있는지를요

translation.en: [Bruce in scene] 770's in the middle.
Not terribly dirty but not perfectly clean either.
translation.ko: 심하게 더러운 건 아닌데 완벽하게 깨끗한 것도 아니죠

translation.en: That doesn't mean there's salmonella,
but it does give you a sense of… of opportunity for salmonella.
It takes 21 days to hatch a chicken from, uh, an embryonated or a fertilized egg.
[Bruce in scene] So he's partially working his way out.
-Taking a break. -[man] Yeah.
[Bruce] Gonna work his way out some more.
[Bruce] The chicks, after they've hatched at the hatchery,
and we've done all we can there to keep them clean,
we move them to the farm.
They come here a day old.
translation.ko: 부화한 지 하루 됐을 때 여기 오죠

translation.en: Day they hatch, we get them here, put them in the chicken house.
translation.ko: 부화한 날에 이곳으로 데려와서 닭장에 넣습니다

translation.en: They stay here about 45 days.
These birds here are about 14 days, two weeks old.
translation.ko: 여기 있는 닭들은 부화한 지 14일, 2주가 지났습니다

translation.en: So we monitor for specific types of salmonella,
translation.ko: 특정 종류의 살모넬라균을 추적 관찰 합니다

translation.en: and we use this sampling technique called boot swabs, or bootie swabs,
translation.ko: 이 표본 추출 기법을 '부츠 채취'라고 부르죠

translation.en: where you take a sock that's doused in skim milk, put it over your boot,
translation.ko: 탈지유를 적신 덧신을 부츠 위에 신고

translation.en: and walk through the chicken house trying to sample as many chicken's droppings
translation.ko: 닭장을 걸어 다니면서 닭똥 표본을 최대한

translation.en: as you can possibly pick up with those boots.
And we figure over 100 chickens contribute to the bootie sample.
translation.ko: 이 부츠 표본에는 100마리 이상의 표본이 들어 있죠

translation.en: We send that to the lab and look for salmonella.
translation.ko: 이것을 연구실에 보내서 살모넬라균이 있는지 봅니다

translation.en: [Bruce in scene] This is boneless, skinless breast.
It comes down the line after it's been taken off the, uh, bone.
It goes into this unit and is washed.
There's some peracetic acid, helps us keep it clean
translation.ko: 과산화아세트산이 들어 있는데 이것이 방금 거친 과정에서

translation.en: from the process that we just did all the way to the package.
translation.ko: 포장할 때까지 청결을 유지하도록 도움을 줍니다

translation.en: We believe that if a bird came in with a little bit of salmonella,
translation.ko: 우리는 살모넬라균이 조금 있는 닭이 들어오더라도

translation.en: it'd be washed off and taken care of.
One of the big broken pieces of the American food safety system
translation.ko: 미국의 식품 안전 체계에서 크게 망가진 부분이

translation.en: is that we don't monitor anything on the farm.
translation.ko: 농장에 대해 어떤 것도 감시하지 않는다는 겁니다

translation.en: Those are off-limits to regulators.
[Lance] The problem lies in that a lot of salmonella is found at the farm level,
translation.ko: 문제는 살모넬라균이 농장 단계, 부화장 단계에서 많이 발견된다는 겁니다

translation.en: at the hatchery level.
And, you know, USDA's jurisdiction doesn't kick in
until those chickens actually enter the slaughter plant.
translation.ko: 닭이 도축 공장으로 들어와야 효력이 발생합니다

translation.en: [assistant] A-mark.
[interviewer] Let's just start off with, tell me what you do for work.
translation.ko: 먼저 무슨 일을 하시는지 말씀해 주세요

translation.en: [inspector in distorted voice] I am a USDA consumer safety inspector,
translation.ko: 저는 미국 농무부 소비자 안전 검사관입니다

translation.en: and I inspect chickens.
We run over 300,000 chickens a day.
We're looking at 175 birds a minute, and they're going by so fast.
There's only one inspector at the very end of the line,
translation.ko: 라인 맨 끝에는 검사관이 단 한 명뿐입니다

translation.en: and they do miss a lot sometimes.
Some of the plants I've worked at,
translation.ko: 제가 작업했던 공장 몇 곳 중에는

translation.en: I feel like the chicken's not safe to go out.
translation.ko: 닭고기를 출하하기에는 안전성이 떨어지는 곳이 있어요

translation.en: I feel like consumers would really be shocked
at some of the stories that we could tell them.
I've seen… [sighs] …plant person throwing chickens in the chiller
and would have fecal matter in them.
I've seen inspectors sleep on the line and product just going on by.
translation.ko: 검사관이 잠든 상태에서 제품이 그냥 지나가는 것도 봤어요

translation.en: And you'll see employees, they've been to the bathroom.
They're not washing their hands.
I've seen… [sighs] …people drop their knives, not attempt to pick them up and wash it,
translation.ko: 칼을 떨어뜨리기라도 하면 그냥 주워서 씻지도 않고

translation.en: just go right back to using it.
They got a quota they gotta meet.
And, you know, I feel like they're there to make a profit
and get the chickens through.
They don't care what shape they're in.
The USDA inspection regime is really… goes back to the early 1900s
translation.ko: 미국 농무부 검사 제도는 1900년대 초반에 만든 겁니다

translation.en: and, you know, Upton Sinclair's book The Jungle.
translation.ko: 미국 농무부 검사 제도는 1900년대 초반에 만든 겁니다 업턴 싱클레어의 '정글'이라는 책이 있죠

translation.en: [narrator] It was not a pleasant novel.
It told of conditions of filth and carelessness in the handling of meat,
translation.ko: 육류를 더러운 환경에서 무신경하게 다루는 장면이 있는데

translation.en: and those who read it became concerned and aroused.
It's an outrage.
[Mike] Meat and poultry inspection laws are designed to deal with the problem
translation.ko: 육류 및 가금류 검사법은 1906년 시어도어 루스벨트 대통령 때 만든 법입니다

translation.en: that Teddy Roosevelt addressed in 1906 in meatpacking plants in Chicago,
translation.ko: 1906년 시어도어 루스벨트 대통령 때 만든 법입니다 시카고의 정육 공장 문제 때문에요

translation.en: which is diseased animals coming into facilities,
spoiled meat being put into the food system.
translation.ko: 상한 고기가 식품 체계에 들어온 거죠

translation.en: [Bill] Frankly, when they built that inspection regime,
we didn't even understand viruses and bacteria.
[man] Every bird must be individually inspected.
translation.ko: 모든 가금류는 반드시 개별 검사를 받아야 합니다

translation.en: It must prove to be wholesome, or else it is condemned.
translation.ko: 건강에 좋다는 것이 증명돼야 하고 그렇지 않으면 폐기됩니다

translation.en: [Marion] What they're expected to do has nothing to do with bacteria.
translation.ko: 검사관들이 하는 일은 세균과 전혀 상관없어요

translation.en: You can't see bacteria.
They're not visible to the naked eye.
[Mike] You have hundreds, if not thousands,
of poultry inspectors sitting on slaughter lines,
translation.ko: 가금류 검사관 수백, 수천 명이 도축 라인에 자리를 잡고

translation.en: watching birds go by, to meet the statutory mandate
translation.ko: 지나가는 닭고기를 봅니다 법으로 정해진 의무를 다하기 위해서

translation.en: to have a US government inspector look at every chicken that goes through a facility
translation.ko: 미국 정부 검사관이 시설 내의 모든 닭고기를 살펴보지만

translation.en: with no meaningful benefit for food safety.
translation.ko: 식품 안전에는 전혀 도움이 안 됩니다

translation.en: It's a waste of hundreds of millions of dollars.
I disagree with that assessment for a number of reasons.
translation.ko: 여러 가지 이유로 그런 평가에 동의하지 않습니다

translation.en: They do look at the product.
That's what the law requires under current statutes.
They look at the records that companies keep
translation.ko: 검사관들은 회사가 보관하고 있는 기록을 검토합니다

translation.en: to ensure that they're doing what they're supposed to do,
translation.ko: 회사 측에서 해야 할 일을 하고 있는지 확인하는 거죠

translation.en: and they sample and test product.
[inspector in distorted voice] We run millions of birds a month.
We test five salmonella samples a month of a whole bird.
translation.ko: 살모넬라균 검사는 한 달에 통닭 표본 5개

translation.en: And we do five samples of parts at our plant.
That's all the USDA does.
translation.ko: 미국 농무부에서 하는 일은 그게 다예요

translation.en: And just because it says that "USDA inspected" on there,
it don't mean nothing because it's gotta be on their label.
translation.ko: 아무 의미가 없어요 라벨에 꼭 들어가야 하는 거니까요

translation.en: I wouldn't want to eat nothing coming from some of the plants myself.
translation.ko: 몇몇 공장에서 생산된 것은 먹고 싶지 않습니다

translation.en: When you bring raw poultry into your kitchen,
you're taking a significant risk.
The real problem is that even somebody as careful as me,
I'm a microbiologist that studies these pathogens,
when I bring these packages into my house,
translation.ko: 저희 집에 가금류 포장육을 가져오게 되면

translation.en: it's really hard not to contaminate things.
I'm gonna open that package,
and I'm immediately gonna put that plastic into the trash.
I'm gonna use my foot.
Then I'm gonna take the chicken
and immediately put it into, you know, hot oil and start frying it.
translation.ko: 즉시 뜨거운 기름에 넣고 튀기기 시작합니다 "오염 02"

translation.en: -[whimsical music plays] -[chicken sizzling]
Then I'm gonna throw away the rest of the package,
but this time I touched the top of the trash can, right?
And then I go wash my hand, and I turn on the faucet.
translation.ko: "오염 06" 손을 씻을 때 수도꼭지를 틀죠 수도꼭지도 오염시켰습니다

translation.en: I've just contaminated the faucet.
translation.ko: 손을 씻을 때 수도꼭지를 틀죠 수도꼭지도 오염시켰습니다

translation.en: I pump the soap. I've just contaminated the soap.
I'm gonna wash my hands really well.
Then I'm gonna rinse my hands, and shut off the faucet.
translation.ko: 그런 다음 손을 헹구고 수도꼭지를 잠급니다

translation.en: I've just recontaminated my hand, and I'm gonna go make a salad.
translation.ko: 손이 다시 오염됐네요 이제 샐러드를 만듭니다

translation.en: As careful as I am, those bacteria get around.
Once that salmonella is dry, it can stay on surfaces for months.
translation.ko: 살모넬라균은 건조되면 표면에서 몇 개월간 생존합니다

translation.en: It could still make someone sick when ingested.
translation.ko: 누군가 섭취하면 병에 걸릴 수 있죠

translation.en: You should know that when you bring raw poultry into your kitchen,
translation.ko: 이걸 아셔야 합니다 가금류 생고기를 부엌에 가져오면

translation.en: you are introducing into your household a biohazard,
translation.ko: 생물학적 위험 요소를 집에 들이는 겁니다

translation.en: and you should handle it accordingly.
[Lance] When you consume salmonella,
some of those strains also are resistant to multiple antibiotics,
translation.ko: 어떤 균주는 여러 항생제에 저항력이 있어서

translation.en: and so the likelihood that a treatment is going to fail is much higher.
translation.ko: 치료가 안 될 가능성이 훨씬 더 높습니다

translation.en: Those bacteria are going to continue to grow in your blood,
translation.ko: 이런 세균이 혈액 속에서 계속 증식하면

translation.en: and sadly, people die of these infections.
translation.ko: 안타깝게도 감염으로 인해 사람이 죽게 되죠

translation.en: [Mansour] So the way we test foods,
I think the samples dropped off here for us to test were five samples
of… of chicken that were purchased from local grocery stores.
translation.ko: 지역 식품점에서 사 온 닭고기 포장육입니다

translation.en: In about one hour, we get results,
whether it has salmonella or not.
translation.ko: 살모넬라균이 있는지 없는지 알 수 있죠

translation.en: [interviewer] On our first day of production, we went to a food safety lab in Seattle.
translation.ko: 저희는 촬영 첫날, 시애틀의 식품 안전 연구소에 갔어요

translation.en: We picked up five brands of raw chicken and tested them.
translation.ko: 5개 브랜드의 생닭 제품을 사서 검사해 봤습니다

translation.en: And we were told by the lab, "You're not gonna get positive results."
translation.ko: 연구소에서는 양성이 나오지 않을 거라고 했죠

translation.en: "It's too small of a sample."
We got one positive results, and it was Perdue.
-Can I just ask for your reaction to that? -[smacks lips]
I would say a chicken is, uh, not even a fair thing to talk about.
translation.ko: 닭고기 하나를 놓고 얘기하는 것은 공정하지 못한 것 같네요

translation.en: Uh, so, I mean, again, we run hundreds of birds
translation.ko: 그러니까, 저희는 현재 상태를 확인하기 위해서

translation.en: in order to understand where we're at.
And the other part is I would wonder
translation.ko: 또 하나는 어떤 종류의 살모넬라균인지도 알고 싶네요

translation.en: what the salmonella was in particular.
translation.ko: 또 하나는 어떤 종류의 살모넬라균인지도 알고 싶네요 - 하지만 그래도… - 살모넬라 인판티스예요

translation.en: [interviewer] It was infantis.
Yeah. Having said that, one chicken is not a fair… uh, fair discussion at all.
translation.ko: 네, 그렇긴 해도 닭고기 하나로 얘기하는 건 불공정하죠

translation.en: [interviewer] What do you think would be a fair sample set?
A hundred and fifty, uh, in a relatively short period of time.
[interviewer] So you're going to be testing 150 chicken parts
for us over the course of five weeks
from the top four major brands in this country.
You're close to the end of testing all one hundred--
We're slightly-- We're about 60% of testing
if you intend to bring in 150.
Great. If I buy chicken at the grocery store,
should I assume it's safe for me?
In this country, if you buy poultry, uh, from any grocery store,
regardless of the brand of poultry that you buy,
your… your primary assumption should be that
it contains pathogens such as salmonella and campylobacter.
The fact of the matter is salmonella in chicken is okay to be sold.
translation.ko: 닭고기의 살모넬라균은 팔아도 괜찮은 걸로 돼 있어요

translation.en: It's not an adulterant.
So it's fine to knowingly sell salmonella, campylobacter-tainted chicken.
translation.ko: 살모넬라균이나 캄필로박터균으로 오염된 걸 알면서 팔아도 괜찮아요

translation.en: There was a famous case where the government and industry simply said
translation.ko: 유명한 사건이 있었는데 정부와 업계가 이렇게 말했습니다

translation.en: that it was the housewife's job to protect the family.
[Brian] What it boils down to
is the courts ruled that, you know, the salmonella can't be considered an adulterant
translation.ko: 법원이 살모넬라균을 불순물이 아니라고 판결한 겁니다

translation.en: because housewives know how to cook chicken.
translation.ko: 주부들은 닭고기를 요리하는 법을 알고 있으니까요

translation.en: [narrator] Can she prepare those favorite dishes of Tim's
translation.ko: 아내는 팀이 가장 좋아하는 요리를 준비할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: just like his mother used to make?
[Brian] And therefore, it doesn't pose a threat to human illness.
translation.ko: 따라서 인간의 질병을 일으킬 위험 요소가 아니라는 거죠

translation.en: [narrator] Remember, it pays to play safe in the kitchen.
translation.ko: 잊지 마세요, 부엌에서 안전하게 행동하면 보답이 따릅니다

translation.en: This terrible court case dealt a death blow
to… to regulation in the United States regarding salmonella.
Sadly, a true death blow to a lot of people since.
translation.ko: 안타깝게도 그 이후로 많은 사람이 실제로 치명타를 입었죠

translation.en: The USDA throws up its hand and says,
translation.ko: 미국 농무부는 두 손을 들고 이렇게 말합니다

translation.en: "Toxic salmonella are a normal part of raw chicken."
"You don't want toxic salmonella? Cook it."
[Bill] That's what we're trying to change.
The burden shouldn't be with consumers.
And that's why we filed a petition with the USDA.
Well, welcome. Let me just say it's so good to really be, uh, with… with all of you.
translation.ko: 반갑습니다, 여러분들을 모두 직접 뵈니까 정말 좋네요

translation.en: I… I just have such high regard for the work that you do and…
translation.ko: 여러분들이 하신 일을 정말 높이 평가하고 있어요

translation.en: I know, Bill, you have petitions that you have moving forward,
translation.ko: 빌, 청원을 내면서 계속 노력하고 계시죠

translation.en: and Sarah, you do, uh, as well.
And I'd love to have you just update me.
translation.ko: 요즘 하고 계신 일을 알려주시면 좋겠네요

translation.en: I made a really broad petition that would essentially encompass
translation.ko: 저는 아주 광범위한 청원을 냈어요 인간에게 질병을 일으키는

translation.en: making all salmonellas that cause human disease an adulterant.
translation.ko: 모든 살모넬라균을 불순물로 지정해 달라고 했습니다

translation.en: Draw a line in the sand and say, you know, "Thou shalt not have a pathogen
translation.ko: 한계를 정하고 이렇게 말하는 거죠 식품에 병원균이 있어서는 안 된다

translation.en: in your food that can sicken or kill your kid."
[chuckles] Science supports that.
Yeah, these pathogens are taking advantage of the gaps we have in our current system.
translation.ko: 네, 이런 병원균이 현재 체계의 빈틈을 파고들고 있습니다

translation.en: Yeah.
I mean, I think the common thread of all the work that we're all doing
translation.ko: 저희가 하는 모든 일의 공통된 맥락은

translation.en: is modernizing the outdated system that we have now.
[splutters] That's the importance of this conversation.
You spoke, Sarah, about the gaps.
-[Sarah] Mm. -Where are-- And I speak legislatively.
Where are the gaps that we need to try to fill in?
We really don't have a government agency
that's able to go onto farms and look at food safety risks.
translation.ko: 농장에 찾아가 식품 안전 위험도를 확인하지 않습니다

translation.en: They can regulate diseases that cause animal illnesses,
translation.ko: 동물 질환을 유발하는 병은 규제할 수 있는데

translation.en: but they turn a blind eye to the diseases that cause human illness.
translation.ko: 인간 질환을 유발할 수 있는 병은 못 본 척하고 있어요

translation.en: If it makes you sick…
[hesitates] …let's regulate it. We can do it,
but I… I don't have to tell anyone around this table
about the strength of the lobby.
-[Bill] Right. -[Brian] Yeah.
[Rosa] You have to know what you're up against.
The food lobbyists are more powerful than the consumer at the moment.
translation.ko: 지금은 식품 로비스트가 소비자보다 더 강력합니다

translation.en: It's… it's very, very political.
In… in a very, um… in my view, in a dangerous way.
translation.ko: 이건 아주… 제 관점에서는 위험한 상황이에요

translation.en: [Marion] Food companies hate regulation.
They pay very expensive lobbyists
to lobby the federal government
to make sure that the regulatory oversight is extremely limited.
Madam chairman and committee members,
as you can appreciate, there are many issues impacting the state
translation.ko: 아시다시피, 닭고기 업계 상황에 영향을 미치는

translation.en: of the chicken industry as I speak to you today.
translation.ko: 여러 문제가 있습니다 오늘 말씀드린 것처럼요

translation.en: [Marion] They go to Congress and say,
"We know you're considering a bill
to pass very tight regulations about food safety."
translation.ko: '식품 안전에 관한 엄격한 규제를 허용하는 것이라고 들었습니다'

translation.en: As Henry Ford once said, "Don't find fault. Find a remedy."
translation.ko: 헨리 포드는 이렇게 말했죠 '결함 말고 해결책을 찾아라'

translation.en: [Bill] As soon as we propose something,
you know, the industry groups are gonna come in, and they're gonna have their stories
translation.ko: 업계 단체들이 와서 이야기를 늘어놓을 겁니다

translation.en: about why this would be burdensome on industry,
translation.ko: 그 제안이 왜 업계에 부담이 되며

translation.en: and meat prices are gonna go higher,
people are gonna lose their jobs, and it's the consumer's responsibility.
translation.ko: 사람들의 일자리를 빼앗는지에 대해서요 그건 소비자의 책임이라고 하죠

translation.en: All those arguments were the ones they said,
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 말하는 이 모든 주장은

translation.en: you know, when E. coli O157:H7 was listed as an adulterant.
translation.ko: 대장균 O157:H7이 불순물로 지정될 때 나왔던 겁니다

translation.en: You know, the world was gonna fall apart, and it didn't.
translation.ko: 세상이 무너질 거라 했는데 그런 일은 없었어요

translation.en: [Mindy] I was the undersecretary for food safety
translation.ko: "민디 브래시어스 박사 전 미국 농무부 부차관" 저는 식품 안전 담당 부차관이었습니다

translation.en: which was the highest-ranking food safety official in the US.
And, I mean, I'm a scientist. I'm not a politician.
I was there to make the food supply safe.
translation.ko: 식품 공급망을 안전하게 만들려고 그 자리에 있었습니다

translation.en: When you put agendas and, you know, political interest aside,
translation.ko: 의도나 정치적 이해 관계를 제쳐 두면

translation.en: then you can solve problems.
You can get data, you can find the answers,
translation.ko: 데이터를 얻을 수 있고 해답을 찾을 수 있죠

translation.en: and then you can find something that actually works.
translation.ko: 실제로 효과가 있는 방법을 찾을 수 있어요

translation.en: Obviously, regulations are important. I'm not saying they're not.
translation.ko: 당연히 규제는 중요하죠 그게 중요하지 않다는 건 아니에요

translation.en: But it's better for us to be able to come to the table
translation.ko: 하지만 규제로 가기 전에 협의할 수 있으면

translation.en: before we have to move to regulation.
[interviewer] When you were nominated for your position by President Trump,
a lobbyist for the National Cattlemen's Beef Association said that this was
translation.ko: 미국 축산육우협회 로비스트는 이런 말을 했습니다

translation.en: great news for the industry.
Why was the industry so excited about you in particular?
Because I'm a scientist,
and they knew I'd make data-driven, science-based decisions.
translation.ko: 데이터 중심의, 과학에 기반한 결정을 내린다는 걸 알았을 겁니다

translation.en: [interviewer] It had nothing to do with the fact
that you had received a lot of money for your research from this very same group over the years?
translation.ko: 그쪽 사람들로부터 수년간 많은 연구비를 받았잖아요

translation.en: No. I mean… [splutters]
I do wish that that money, you know, was my personal money.
translation.ko: 그 돈이 제 개인 돈이었으면 좋겠네요

translation.en: It never-- It wasn't. It was university given to--
translation.ko: 그건 절대 아니에요 대학에서 받은 것이고…

translation.en: It was money given to the university to do research.
translation.ko: 그 돈은 대학에 연구비로 지원된 거예요

translation.en: And that's how we fund research programs, is through grants from the cattlemen,
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 연구비를 조성하죠 미국 축산육우협회나

translation.en: through, uh, you know, the meat institute, all those different organizations.
[interviewer] Are you saying it isn't a conflict of interest for you to regulate
translation.ko: 연구비를 지원받은 사람이 지원해 준 업계를 규제하는 게

translation.en: the very industry that has funded so many of your studies?
It didn't necessarily change the way I looked at the industry at all.
translation.ko: 지원금을 받았다고 업계에 대한 시선이 바뀌진 않았어요

translation.en: If anything, you know, I knew where the pathogens were
and how to control them and all of those different components of the industry.
translation.ko: 그것을 어떻게 통제할지와 업계의 다양한 요소를 알고 있었죠

translation.en: So I think it just made me a stronger person in that position.
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 그 자리에 유력한 후보자가 됐던 것 같아요

translation.en: [interviewer] Was your nomination also great news, do you think,
for the consumers that rely on the government to keep their food safe?
translation.ko: 정부가 식품 안전을 책임지리라 믿는 소비자에게도요?

translation.en: Yes. I'm a very strong consumer advocate.
translation.ko: 네, 저는 소비자를 강력하게 옹호하는 사람이에요

translation.en: And, you know, it's not just, you know, Mindy Brashears, you know.
It's everyone in government.
They get into this… you know, into this political realm.
And it doesn't seem like they really
are paying attention to the people's business.
translation.ko: 그러면서 다른 사람들의 사정에는 제대로 관심을 기울이지 않는 것 같아요

translation.en: [interviewer] Have you made a decision on the Marler petition yet?
translation.ko: 말러 청원서에 대한 결정은 아직 못 내렸나요?

translation.en: No, we have not.
We are examining and assessing the requests in the context
of our larger salmonella initiative.
translation.ko: 저희의 더 큰 살모넬라균 계획의 맥락 안에서요

translation.en: Their goal in each of the petitions is to do a better job
translation.ko: 청원의 목표는 살모넬라균을 줄여 보자는 거죠

translation.en: at reducing salmonella, the strains that make people sick.
translation.ko: 사람들을 병에 걸리게 하는 균주를 줄이자는 겁니다

translation.en: We have the same exact goal.
When Mike Taylor deemed E. coli O157:H7 an adulterant,
translation.ko: 마이크 테일러가 대장균 O157:H7을 불순물로 간주했을 때

translation.en: he had complete authority to do that.
translation.ko: 그렇게 할 수 있는 완전한 권한을 갖고 있었죠

translation.en: There's absolutely no reason that,
uh, Sandy Eskin couldn't do exactly the same thing on her own right now.
translation.ko: 샌드라 에스킨도 자기 권한으로 똑같은 일을 할 수 있었어요

translation.en: [interviewer] She has the authority?
Absolutely. She has the authority to deem salmonella an adulterant in chicken.
translation.ko: 닭고기의 살모넬라균을 불순물로 간주할 권한이 있어요

translation.en: [interviewer] So why doesn't she?
Because, uh, the industry would…
And I should say this knowing that it's chicken,
the industry would squawk, um, and they would squawk loudly.
I feel like the industry hasn't held up their end of the bargain.
translation.ko: 업계가 아직 할 일을 다하지 않는 것 같아요

translation.en: You can go to Europe
and buy packages that are labeled,
you know, "pathogen-free" there.
You can't get that in the United States.
translation.ko: 미국에선 그런 것을 살 수가 없죠

translation.en: [Sarah] They went back to the farm,
and they prioritized getting rid of the worst types of salmonella
translation.ko: 제일 먼저 한 일이 가장 심각한 유형의 살모넬라균을

translation.en: that make humans sick.
