[Bill] They vaccinate chicken against salmonella.
They sometimes eradicate flocks that are contaminated with salmonella,
and they do those interventions before they hit the slaughterhouse
translation.ko: 닭이 도축장까지 가기 전에 개입을 하는 거죠

translation.en: because once they hit the slaughterhouse, you know, it's not gonna help.
So it's not like we can't do it.
translation.ko: 그러니 우리가 할 수 없는 건 아닙니다

translation.en: Um, we just don't have the political will yet to do it.
translation.ko: 그렇게 하려는 정치적 의지가 아직 없는 것뿐이죠

translation.en: When you look at what happened to Stephanie Ingberg,
there's no question we're not doing enough.
translation.ko: 할 일을 충분히 안 하고 있는 겁니다

translation.en: The government's not doing enough. The industry's not doing enough.
translation.ko: 정부가 안 하고 있고 업계도 안 하고 있죠

translation.en: [Scott] Stephanie, you know, when we first found out
that first morning that she was back that she may not live very much longer,
translation.ko: 데리고 돌아온 첫날 아침 오래 못 살 거라던 아이가

translation.en: the fact that she didn't die, uh, gave us hope. She was still with us.
translation.ko: 그때까지 죽지 않았다는 사실이 희망을 줬습니다

translation.en: She was still in a coma. We couldn't communicate with her.
translation.ko: 의식 불명 상태였고 의사소통도 안 됐지만요

translation.en: They… they didn't know why she wasn't waking up.
translation.ko: 병원에서는 왜 스테퍼니가 깨어나지 않는지 모르더군요

translation.en: And I think that's what led to the question about the brain injury,
that she just wasn't waking up.
The priest came in saying a prayer.
And during that prayer, her eyes just started to slit open.
And that was the first sign of waking up.
translation.ko: 그게 깨어날 것이라는 첫 번째 신호였어요

translation.en: Yeah.
[sniffles] Okay.
[Stephanie] I specifically remember when I woke up,
everyone was surrounding me, and everyone was very emotional around me.
translation.ko: 저를 둘러싸고 있던 모두가 감정에 북받친 상태였어요

translation.en: I'm like, "What is the big deal? Why is everyone so sad right now?"
translation.ko: 제가 이랬죠 '무슨 일이죠? 왜 다들 슬퍼해요?'

translation.en: "I don't understand."
So they were telling me that I got, um, a strain of E. coli.
translation.ko: 병원에서는 저한테 대장균 균주가 있다고 했어요

translation.en: [Pablo] Okay.
Do you have any pain when I poke in there?
-No. -[Pablo] No.
[Stephanie] And it can give you HUS, which is a fatal kidney disease,
translation.ko: 용혈성 요독 증후군이라는 치명적인 신장 질환을 일으킨대요

translation.en: which is what I got.
[Pablo] This condition in her body was like a nuclear bomb exploding inside you,
translation.ko: 스테퍼니의 상태는 몸속에서 핵폭탄이 터진 것과 같았죠

translation.en: where it hits every single organ,
and then you have to get there and pick up the pieces.
translation.ko: 그런 다음에는 정상으로 돌아가게 해야 합니다

translation.en: [Pablo in scene] Okay, good, we're gonna go to the left side now.
[Stephanie] It took me a long time to rebuild my strength.
translation.ko: 기력을 회복하는 데 오랜 시간이 걸렸어요

translation.en: -[Pablo] Feels better, huh? -[chuckles]
My coma kind of knocked me out for the hardest parts,
translation.ko: 혼수상태에 빠져 정신을 잃은 게 제일 힘들었지만

translation.en: but I know there were moments
that my family and my doctors didn't think I was gonna make it through,
translation.ko: 제가 이겨내지 못할 거라고 생각하던 때가 있었다는 걸 알아요

translation.en: which has been really hard on them.
And it's hard for me to know that I put them through that pain.
translation.ko: 저도 힘들었어요 그런 고통을 견뎌내야 했으니까요

translation.en: But…
Yeah.
Control it all the way. I'm gonna look at your knees as you go.
translation.ko: 끝까지 조절해 보는 거야 내가 무릎을 봐줄게

translation.en: [Stephanie] I had a lot of physical therapy,
a handful of outpatient dialysis visits.
translation.ko: 퇴원 후에도 병원 가서 신장 투석을 받았고요

translation.en: I had doctor's appointments every day.
My mom couldn't go back to work for months because she had to drive me
translation.ko: 엄마는 여러 달 동안 휴직하고 저를 데리고 다니셨죠

translation.en: to probably two or three doctor's appointments every day.
You know, I had a few goals set in place that helped motivate me.
translation.ko: 동기 부여에 도움이 되는 목표를 몇 개 세웠어요

translation.en: You know, I was graduating in May.
Being able to, um, you know, walk at graduation
translation.ko: 졸업식에 걸어서 갈 수 있게 되는 거

translation.en: was one of my biggest goals because at the time I couldn't walk.
translation.ko: 그게 제일 큰 목표였어요 그땐 걷지도 못했거든요

translation.en: And I'm crying, but I achieved all those goals.
translation.ko: 눈물이 나네요 하지만 모든 목표를 달성했어요

translation.en: You know, I… I got to go to prom. I got to walk at graduation…
translation.ko: 졸업 무도회도 갔고 졸업식에 걸어서 갔죠

translation.en: …which, you know, I feel like I'm pretty lucky
translation.ko: 저는 정말 운이 좋은 것 같아요

translation.en: to be able to say I was able to do,
given the circumstances. [sniffles]
You are still having protein spillage in the urine.
That is unfortunately not normal.
And that's why we're using, uh, this medication, Lisinopril.
Unfortunately, uh,
it's been four years now, and I'm not seeing this going away.
[Stephanie] I'm kind of nervous for what the future holds
translation.ko: 앞으로 제 신장이 어떻게 될지 좀 걱정이긴 해요

translation.en: with my kidney health and everything. I try not to think about it.
translation.ko: 앞으로 제 신장이 어떻게 될지 좀 걱정이긴 해요 그런 생각은 안 하려고 하지만요

translation.en: I have to take a medication every day
to try to tighten the filters in my kidneys.
I've talked to my nephrologist, and there's a possibility
that I might have to get a kidney transplant.
I mean, I might have to be on dialysis for the rest of my life.
translation.ko: 신장 이식을 해야 하거나 평생 투석을 받아야 할지도 모른대요

translation.en: Like, you never wanna hear that.
[Sarah] I think some people tend to brush off foodborne illness.
translation.ko: 식품 매개 질병을 무시하는 사람들도 있죠

translation.en: Oh, it's a little stomach ache.
You know, it's some extra time in the bathroom. It's no big deal.
translation.ko: 화장실에서 시간을 좀 더 보내면 된다, 별일 아니다

translation.en: [Stephanie] It is so much more than that, you know.
It's comas and brain damage and kidney trauma
translation.ko: 혼수상태에 빠지고 뇌손상이 오며 신장에 후유증이 남죠

translation.en: and definitely should be taken seriously.
I ate a salad, and, you know,
now I have long-term health effects from it.
[Brian] If you were to develop a list of the highest-risk foods right now,
romaine lettuce would be near the top, if not at the top.
translation.ko: 로메인상추가 첫손에 꼽히거나 적어도 상위권을 차지할 겁니다

translation.en: [interviewer] I'm curious if you eat romaine?
I don't.
[interviewer] Do you eat romaine?
[splutters] I do steer clear of romaine for the most part.
I mean, I think about it every time I eat it.
I, you know… I've rolled the dice. [laughs]
[interviewer] Are there any foods that you both absolutely avoid?
translation.ko: 두 분 다 절대 안 드시는 식품이 있나요? "줄리 말러 빌의 아내"

translation.en: Bagged-- We don't buy prepackaged bagged salads.
-Um… -[Julie] Yeah.
We kind of tend to shy away from romaine, especially from Yuma or Salinas.
translation.ko: 로메인상추는 피하려고 하죠 특히 유마나 살리나스산은요

translation.en: [interviewer] Has the LGMA response prevented leafy greens outbreaks in your opinion?
translation.ko: LGMA가 잎채소 식중독 발생에 책임이 있다고 보세요?

translation.en: LGMA has made a significant difference in this industry.
[interviewer] Are there any studies that document
the improvement of safety after the implementation of LGMA?
translation.ko: 안전이 향상됐다는 것을 증명하는 연구가 있나요?

translation.en: I don't know of any. [inhales]
[interviewer] So you say that you feel confident that it's prevented certain outbreaks--
translation.ko: 어떤 식중독 발생을 막았다고 확신하신다고 말씀하셨는데요…

translation.en: Absolutely.
[interviewer] I want to run through
some things that have gone down the past five years.
So September 2017, eight people sick from spinach.
November 2017, 67 people sick from another unknown leafy green outbreak.
translation.ko: 2017년 11월, 또 다른 미상의 잎채소 식중독 환자 67명 발생

translation.en: Then the following year in March, a big one, 248 people, five dead.
April 2018, ten people.
October 2018, three separate leafy green outbreaks, sickening 135 people.
November, same thing, 167 people sick.
November 2019, two more outbreaks that same year.
October 2020, 40 people.
This isn't a great track record, is it?
I think we have a lot to be proud of.
translation.ko: 자부심을 가질 만한 게 많다고 생각해요

translation.en: Certainly, every one of those is… is a tragic incident
translation.ko: 물론 말씀하신 그 모든 사건들은 불행한 일이고

translation.en: and the effect it had on those consumers.
translation.ko: 그로 인해 피해를 본 소비자가 있습니다

translation.en: But I am confident of the progress that we have made through the LGMA
and the difference we have made in the industry.
[Christine] One thing that jumped out at me when reporting
on these romaine lettuce outbreaks is how little the federal government
translation.ko: 로메인상추 식중독 발생 보도 때 연방 정부의 문제 해결 노력은

translation.en: was doing to address them.
For many years, we've given the responsibility to the businesses
translation.ko: 여러 해 동안, 기업이 할 일을 이야기해 왔고

translation.en: and let them take responsibility, and that's not working.
translation.ko: 그들에게 책임을 지라고 했지만 별 효과가 없었습니다

translation.en: [interviewer] I'm being asked to wrap up.
What do you want the viewers to know about this issue?
translation.ko: 이 문제에 관해서 시청자들이 알아야 할 것이 있다면요?

translation.en: Well, I would like your viewers to know
that the US has among the safest food systems in the world.
translation.ko: 미국은 전 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 체계를 갖췄다는 겁니다

translation.en: But we plan to work together to create an even safer, more digital,
translation.ko: 저희는 훨씬 더 안전하고 디지털화됐으며 투명하며

translation.en: transparent, and sustainable food system that's going to be good for consumers.
translation.ko: 지속 가능한 식품 체계를 만들어 소비자에게 도움이 되려 합니다

translation.en: It'll be good for producers, and it will be good for the planet.
translation.ko: 그러면 생산자에게도 좋고 지구에도 좋을 것입니다

translation.en: I can't even tell you how many times
translation.ko: 그런 소리를 얼마나 많이 들었는지 몰라요

translation.en: I have heard policymakers, executives, leaders say the phrase,
translation.ko: 정책 입안자, 사업가, 지도자들은 이런 말을 합니다

translation.en: "America has the safest food system in the world."
translation.ko: '미국은 전 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 체계를 갖추고 있다'

translation.en: But there seems to have been this endless cycle
translation.ko: 하지만 미국 식품 체계는 끊임없이 이런 걸 반복하죠

translation.en: of failure and outbreaks and recalls and illnesses and deaths.
translation.ko: 실패하고 식중독이 발생하고 리콜, 질병, 사망을 부릅니다

translation.en: You know, when I hear politicians say,
"We've got the safest food system in the world,"
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 가장 안전한 식품 체계라고요

translation.en: it's just… it's laughable. We don't have the safest food system in the world.
translation.ko: 터무니없죠, 우리 식품 체계가 가장 안전하지는 않아요

translation.en: I mean, these pathogens are controllable. We're not controlling them.
translation.ko: 이런 병원균은 통제할 수 있어요 우리가 안 하려는 것뿐이죠

translation.en: We're in the United States. We expect better.
translation.ko: 우리는 미국에 살고 있어요 더 나은 것을 기대합니다

translation.en: And when the safety of our food supply lets us down, it lets us down big-time.
translation.ko: 식품 공급망의 안전성이 기대에 어긋난다면 실망스럽겠죠

translation.en: [Brian] Right now, the government is not doing enough to protect consumers.
translation.ko: 지금은 정부가 소비자를 보호하려는 노력이 부족해요

translation.en: And then consumers, because the burden is often on them
translation.ko: "미국 보건복지부 식품의약국" 이런 상황에서는 소비자가 부담을 지게 되니까

translation.en: when it gets to that level,
translation.ko: 이런 상황에서는 소비자가 부담을 지게 되니까

translation.en: you know, they have to make sure that they're taking the proper steps at home.
I would say number one food on my list that I avoid is cantaloupe.
translation.ko: 제가 안 먹는 음식 중에서 첫손으로 꼽는 것이 캔털루프예요

translation.en: You cannot properly clean the outside,
and once you bring that knife through it, it's too late.
translation.ko: 일단 칼로 잘랐다고 하면 너무 늦어 버리죠

translation.en: And there's no kill step for cantaloupe.
Number two is sprouts.
Every other year, there's a significant outbreak
where there's just no way to clean them.
I would say number three would be bagged lettuce.
Your spring mix. Your different salad mixes.
translation.ko: 어린잎 믹스나 다양한 샐러드 믹스에 들어간

translation.en: You don't necessarily know how many heads of lettuce that came from.
translation.ko: 상추는 몇 포기에서 나왔는지 알 수가 없습니다

translation.en: Or do you even know if it came from any one place?
[Bill] All the outbreaks that I've been involved in
translation.ko: 제가 관여한 모든 잎채소 식중독 발생은

translation.en: are triple-washed, bagged, and shipped around the country.
translation.ko: 3중 세척 후 봉투에 넣어 나라 전역에 배송한 것에서 나왔죠

translation.en: You know, buy it in a whole head and wash it yourself.
translation.ko: 한 포기를 통째로 사서 직접 세척하세요

translation.en: Control your own environment.
[Sarah] Today, when we were ordering lunch,
I avoided everything that has that little star on it on the menu
translation.ko: 메뉴에서 이런 별 표시가 들어간 것은 다 피했어요

translation.en: saying consumption of undercooked meat can expose you to risk.
translation.ko: 덜 익힌 육류를 먹으면 위험에 노출될 수 있으니까요

translation.en: So there was some raw fish they were serving,
and I, uh, took a pass on that one.
[Timothy] You need to decide, "Am I a person who loves raw oysters enough
translation.ko: 여러분은 결정하셔야 해요 저는 생굴을 좋아해서

translation.en: that I want to take the risks that are associated with raw oysters?"
[Sarah] I don't wanna be one of those people who ends up losing a limb because of, uh, you know, a night out.
translation.ko: 저는 밤 외출 한번 잘못했다가 사지를 하나 잃고 싶진 않아요

translation.en: Yeah.
Thank you. Thank you very much.
Thanks.
What are you having?
I'm gonna have a hamburger cooked to 155 degrees internal temperature,
uh, french fries,
and that's it.
[server] Okay. You got it.
[Ben] When you go to a restaurant and you want to order a hamburger,
the best thing to do is order to temperature,
translation.ko: 가장 좋은 방법이 온도를 정해서 주문하는 거예요

translation.en: because medium rare, rare, well-done, those are all subjective.
translation.ko: 미디엄 레어, 레어, 웰던 같은 것은 모두 주관적이에요

translation.en: You can't look at color or whether juices run clear.
And if they say, "We don't have a thermometer. We can't cook to that."
translation.ko: 그렇게 했는데, 온도계가 없어서 조리를 못 한다고 하면

translation.en: Then I'd order something else.
I think when I first started doing this kind of work,
translation.ko: 이런 사건을 처음 맡아서 진행할 때는

translation.en: I kind of thought that,
you know, if you sued enough people and you took enough money,
translation.ko: 많은 사람을 고소하고 돈을 충분히 받아내면

translation.en: that that would change their behavior.
I just turned 64, you know,
and I just don't feel like I've accomplished what I was hoping to do.
translation.ko: 제가 하고 싶었던 일을 다 이루지는 못한 것 같아요

translation.en: So…
'Cause I really did think, you know… I really did think that, you know,
by the time I got to this stage that,
um, you know, this kind of thing wouldn't be happening anymore.
translation.ko: 이런 일이 더는 일어나지 않을 거라고요

translation.en: But it happens
all the time.
♪ Buried, banging at your door ♪
translation.ko: "말러의 청원을 받은 후" "농무부는 일부 닭고기 제품에서 살모넬라균을 허용 않기로 했다"

translation.en: ♪ Don't hear a sound… ♪
translation.ko: "살모넬라균은 여전히" "대부분의 미국 판매 닭고기 제품에 법적으로 허용된다"

translation.en: After my son died, I assumed that either the government,
translation.ko: 제 아들이 죽고 나서 정부, 법률, 정책, 과학 기술 어떤 것이든

translation.en: you know, laws and policies,
translation.ko: 정부, 법률, 정책, 과학 기술 어떤 것이든

translation.en: or science and technology would take care of this.
translation.ko: 이 문제를 해결할 수 있다고 생각했죠

translation.en: We wouldn't be dealing with food safety like we're talking about in 1993.
translation.ko: 1993년에 얘기하던 식으로 식품 안전을 다루진 않을 거라고요

translation.en: ♪ A rising steam… ♪
translation.ko: "데트와일러 교수는 미래의 산업 지도자들에게" "식품 안전을 가르치는 데 힘쓰고 있다"

translation.en: Regulators have the ability to set the tone and to build a framework
translation.ko: 규제 기관은 분위기를 조성하고 업계가 옳은 일을 하도록 체계를 만들 수 있습니다

translation.en: that encourages industry to do the right thing.
translation.ko: 업계가 옳은 일을 하도록 체계를 만들 수 있습니다

translation.en: ♪ On the devil's tree ♪
♪ I clutched a branch… ♪
translation.ko: "더 많은 권한을 가지는 법안을 준비하고 있다"

translation.en: If the public makes their voices heard
and puts pressure on their legislators,
let them know that this is not acceptable,
translation.ko: 이 상황이 괜찮지 않다는 걸 알게 해 준다면

translation.en: then I believe, yes, legislators will act on their behalf.
translation.ko: 그러면 의원들이 사람들을 위해 행동에 나설 겁니다

translation.en: ♪ I walk alone ♪ ♪ Beside myself… ♪
translation.ko: "로사 델라우로는 여전히 하원에서 식품 안전을 위해 싸우고 있다"

translation.en: I think you just have to keep fighting the battles that are in front of you,
translation.ko: 눈앞에 있는 싸움을 계속해 나가야 한다고 생각해요

translation.en: and I still think there are things more to do, um, so I guess I got to get busy.
translation.ko: 여전히 할 일이 더 많다고 생각하니까, 더 바빠지겠죠

translation.en: ♪ My flesh and bone ♪
